Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: jennyrs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at 27th and Madison, which was easy access from Penn station. We were in New York for a wedding and spent little time in the room. Like most New York hotels the rooms are tiny, but have all the amenities I was looking for: A nice bed, internet access, an iron and ironing board, and a helpful front desk. We showed up a couple hours or so before check-in and the hotel was able to finish cleaning a room and let us check in early so we could start getting ready for the wedding. The front desk was helpful with directions and suggestions for bars and restaurants in the area. The bar right next door is a Philly cheesesteak place with a very nice selection of beer on tap. It was a good place to wait for our room to be ready. Overall this is a very good hotel for NYC. It doesn't get an excellent rating for minor things: the room size is small, there is no restroom in the lobby, and there is no mirror in the bedroom which makes it a little more difficult for 2 people to get ready at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: EJPel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in celebration of his 40th birthday. Before our arrival I emailed the hotel and asked them to put a bottle of champagne in the room for when we arrived. They responded with a really welcoming email and as requested, the bottle was on ice as we were shown in....what was better is that they did not charge me for it either! The hotel itself was very clean, had a lovely standard of decor and the staff were absolutely fantastic. They provided a map of the city, and an information sheet that included recommended restaurants near by. While the hotel does not provide food, complimentary pastries, tea and coffee were provided each morning in reception. One tip would be that the Urban Standard double room (the smallest rooms) are very small, fine for a one night stay, but when I saw it I decided to upgrade as for four nights it would have been too small. However, the upgrade was so much cheaper than what it would have been when booking online so worth booking the urban and then upgrading on arrival. The hotel is in a prime location, a 5 minute walk away from the Empire State Building and comfortable walking distance to Times Sq, 5th Avenue etc. I would recommend The Mave highly, it was perfect for the price and the staff made it all the more enjoyable....oh yes and the showers were lovely, really hot water at all times!

Reviews.Title: “5 NIGHT STAY”
Reviews.Author: VORDIE67
Reviews.Content: What can i say!!!, This was a fantastic hotel in a smart location, It's in walking distance to the entire local and national treasures. the staff were fantastic in offering help & assistance and went out of there way in making sure we were at easy with the fast pace life style of New York. We were put off with the breakfast at first but it turned out to be very refreashing, excellent coffee, muffins and a great choice - a great start to the day. The room was cleaned daily and we had freash towels as well, the bed was very comfy with all the modernfacilities of a higher rated hotel.The only 2 things I would change would be British newspaper's instead of New York news, that would have been a nice touch and a little better noise reduction around the windows would have been great, New York cabs enjoy the sound of there own horns even @ 6:00am..... I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel and would award the hotel 95% out of 100%. I TRUELY RECOMARKABLE EXPERIANCE

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist hotel, especially the tiny hip rooms”
Reviews.Author: honeoyefallsmb
Reviews.Content: A small "boutique" hotel on Madison and 27th. Convenient location, very slim on services. The bed was comfy and the room had about 2' on either side of the bed, but the clean white and black rooms were attractive. Grab and Go breakfast in the lobby was the requirement because there is literally no place to stand and enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cindytherella
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot, fairly close to times square and subways. The front desk people were more than happy to help with what ever activity you choose. The beds were wonderful our blvd king room was # 1105 as high up as you can get without staying in a penthouse or suite. The bathroom was just right! We also liked the robes that were provided.Next door is Shorty's they had good food and good drinks. They were very friendly! Cindy any other questions you can email me sleepbeachcindy@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Midtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rick H
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, from Friday to Monday, on a trip to celebrate our anniversary. The staff were unfailingly courteous and friendly. When I asked why our room did not have a coffeemaker like the ones in the website pictures, the gentleman manning the front desk informed me that our level room did not include that. However, he offered to find one and send it to our room anyway, which he did. The room was very clean and looked new. The only complaint we had was the street noise. Even on the 10th floor, it could be annoying. The continental breakfast was simple but the coffee and pastries were both very good. The location was excellent. The Flatiron area itself is loaded with restaurants, etc. and we were only one block from the subway. Times Square/Theater district was only a few stops away. Overall, we were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “MAve of Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Candi W
Reviews.Content: What a GEM. A small hotel located in midtown Manhattan. Loaction is prime, with walking distance to the the Flatiron distrisct. The staff was very knowledgable of all restaurants and sites. Kudos to Jeffrey and Felicia. You name a restaurant preference, they were able to recommend a few. There was adequate roominess, especially given what one would expect in a downtown hotel. Price was very competitive. I will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SGKC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night. The day we checked in they had an issue with a water main break so we ended up being downgraded to a Urban Full room from a Madison Queen due to them being at capacity. The first room we received stunk of cigeratte smoke so we asked to be moved to another room which they graciously did. The room was extremely small and for two adults that normally sleep in a king sized bed, a full was not the most confortable. If it wasn't for the excellent staff, I would have given this hotel a much worse review but they were dedicated to making our stay as nice as possible with the issues that arose. The lcoation is perfect if you enjoy lower Manhattan. Madison Square Park is two blocks down which has a wonderful view of the Flatiron Building, Union Square is not far from here either which on a Saturday has the best Farmer's Market. If you stay here, you must go nextdoor to Shorty's for a quick drink - also had amazing staff (Mike and Lauren). Overall this hotel was good. Next time I stay, I hopefully get the room I asked for. They do have a penthouse suite which I would love to check out too! **Quick note - ladies, bring you're own toiletries - the items they supplied dried my hair and skin out soo bad!

Reviews.Title: “Good all round Hotel in a Great location!”
Reviews.Author: nictaylor1977
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through the Voyage Prive site and it was great!!! The Mave Hotel, NY is a good all round hotel, in a great location. It is near to the Empire State Building and close to the Flatiron building too (On Madison/around 27th St) Check-in was fast and the staff were helpful but not intrusive. In reception there is a touchscreen monitor with tourist information including maps which was very handy. The room we had (Madison Queen) was spacious in NYC terms and well equipped, with a good size bathroom (shower only) and nice toiletries. The room included bathrobes, a safe and iron. Yes the skirting boards are a little scuffed and the laminate flooring has the odd mark but hey, the room has been used by several guests before, so there will be some wear and tear! It is not a luxurious hotel but it is very clean and comfortable and has everything that you need. The bedding however was luxurious and honestly is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. So much so, that one evening having walked around all day, we came back to freshen up and fell soundly asleep on the bedâ€¦waking up after midnight !!!! So be careful ï�Š There is some street noise (as others have said) but it is the city that never sleeps, so you can expect that. But it didnâ€™t keep us awake. The complimentary breakfast is nice if you like pastries, muffins etc and is accompanied with good coffee (and tea). Some fruit would have been a welcomed but not the end of the world. We had the option of a late check-out but in the end didnâ€™t need it and the staff were happy to organise a cab to the airport. The hotel has free wi-fi in all areas; which was useful too. All in all, we had a really good experience in a nice hotel in a great location. It was good value and met most of our requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Fab place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pippa L
Reviews.Content: We booked The MAve through Virgin Holidays and couldn't have wished for a better place to stay. We had a booking for 25 people as we were staying in New York for our wedding. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, they were all without fail so helpful and friendly. The rooms were lovely and the hotel even upgraded us to the Penthouse, which was just amazing! The hotel really added to our experience, it is in a fantastic location and has a great little bar next door (Shorty's) that a lot of our party spent a lot of time in. Thanks to everyone at The MAve!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Deal”
Reviews.Author: FiWilkes
Reviews.Content: We booked The MAve through the Voyage Prive members site before reading any reviews and were really pleased with our decision. We had an upgrade deal on the room so ended up in one of the larger rooms on the 10th floor. Ample room, comfy bed, pillows and a shower that worked. We didn't have any complaints about the place. We had the grab & go breakfast a couple of days, but preferred to sit down and eat so found a little diner / cafe around the corner on Broadway. Hotel is ideally located for all parts of the city and a subway station over on Park Ave and 28th St to get both up and down town. If you eat at The Shake Shack in Madison Square Park, don't sit near the railings as you'll get attacked by the squirrels who are really greedy & cheeky............but the shakes are good!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice price in good location”
Reviews.Author: the_oslo_gooner
Reviews.Content: The recently renovated MAve is perfectly situated on the corner of 27th & Madison. Within walking distance to the subway, as well as several restaurants (from simple taqueriaa to three star michelin restaurants). The room (madison queen) was larger than expected. Fresh looking and clean. Mind you, if you are sensitive to street noice (which Manhattan has a great deal of) this might not be the place for you. The windows are quite thin, so lets in quite a lot noice. Also, walls and door to hallway not he most soundproof either. So if total silence is your thing, look elsewhere. The beds are on the soft side. There is a breakfast served between 7am and 9am. This breakfast is served in the lobby (no seats really, so bring it back to your room, or grab a bite on your way out). Coffee and pastry (muffin, danish) is what you can expect. If you need a fuller and/or healthier breakfast, there are ample choices within just a block. A small hotel (approx 70 rooms) and a perfect base for exploring New York City. I would not hesitate going back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kristen S
Reviews.Content: Such a nice and clean hotel. Everyone was very helpful while we stayed there. The room was small but very comfy. It was also nice that they had a complimentary breakfest too. It is also close to so many attractions too. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Jotomtaymia
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but your not in your room long enough to worry about that, and everything is provided and clean. I would def stay there again and the complimentary breakfast is lovely it might be served it the foyer but most hotels don't offer anything and it's a nice start to your morning, the staff are very friendly and can't do enough for you 10/10 Jo and Sylvia - England

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff, extra comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: New_Reviewer_7
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for my sisters wedding in NYC and I found it excellent. We had a room with a king bed which was fabulous, the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in with AMAZING pillows. The room was not huge but it had everything we needed including a desk, who spends much time in their room when they're in NYC anyway??!! The 'grab and go' breakfast in the morning was great, there was always plenty of choice and I noticed that on most mornings there was plenty left even after 10am, most mornings I was the only one down there when I visited. There were 24 of us staying in total and the staff were happy to recommend places, order cars and generally be very helpful whenever we needed it, they couldn't have been more pleasant. They upgraded my sister and her new husband to the penthouse suite which was just lovely (if you want more space, this was the place to be - it's lovely!!) Traffic noise was loud at times in the room but you are staying on one of the world's busiest city so I think it would be very difficult to get away from this and it was not enough to disturb me. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel, there is also a lovely little sports bar next door - Shortys, we were regulars there and the staff, drinks and food were great!!

Reviews.Title: “A good place if you know what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: bw1001
Reviews.Content: Mave is in a great location and is a fine hotel. I have stayed there 1x for business travel. Good points are reasobably priced, great location, very comfortable bed, super clean, and great front desk service. On the downside, the rooms are super small or at least the one I stayed in. Let me say again, super small. No desk to work at if you are a business traveler. The gym is not really a gym, but a treadmill situated right next to an exercise bike. And make sure to ask for a room that is not right on the road or higher up than the 5th floor. Traffic noise was super loud.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: p_canberra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently staying at The Mave over Christmas for 5 nights travelling from Australia. We both really enjoyed our stay at The Mave, we were in a Queen room on the 11th floor I think. The bed was unbelievably comfortable! Exactly what you need when you have jet lag for 3 days! The rooms were modern or at least they had been recently renovated - we were always nice and warm and the tv had alot of channels to offer and the room was big enough for us both to have our own luggage space and still be able to walk around without having to climb over anything. I did read alot of the reviews prior to booking this place. Yes there is only one elevator but it didn't bother us one little bit at all!! We didn't have any of the breakfast there so I cannot comment on that (this wasn't because we didn't like it, it was simply because we wanted to go to experience different places to eat) - however I can say that there is a really nice cheap breakfast place around the corner next to the Gershwin Hotel. It is in a really quiet convenient area - you are only 2 - 3 blocks away from 2 different subway stops. I think it is in a great location because you can easily walk towards time square area or go downtown or uptown. The hotel is also only a block away from the Flatiron building - so all in all there is alot of nice walks to go on. Because it was more expensive over new years we stayed at a different hotel over new years and it was nothing compared to the Mave. I would definitely recommend this place to others and when we go back to New York I would hope that we get to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean room but it's tiny the service and attention to detail could be improved.”
Reviews.Author: GHinkel
Reviews.Content: Currently visiting New York and if I didn't pay for room upfront we would consider looking for somewhere else to stay rather than paying for upgrade. We booked a shopping package and we received our 10% off Macy's voucher the day after we visited the store and I am still waiting for the promised tote bag. Pros - Good location Clean room and bathroom with nice toiletries Extras like dressing gown, iron, hair dryer, iPod dock are nice but taking up packing space. Handy to have safe in room for piece of mind while out Good WiFi connection Coffee and breakfast to go is good (although put out some small paper bags so people can actually take the muffins to go rather than standing awkwardly in the lobby) Cons - Urban suite room should be sold as a single, no room to swing a cat if there are more than one staying. Bed is against the wall so make sure the one sleeping in the corner doesn't have to get up too many times during the night. If they removed to huge minibar or the useless second phone you might even be able to fit in a bedside lamp. Took engineering 2 requests at the front desk to replace our non-working remote. One lift is currently out of order so take the stairs down rather than wait. There is double glazing but between the noisy fan and New York traffic make sure you are tired when going to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location....great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreaMaz
Reviews.Content: We arrived for 4 nights and did upgrade straight away because the room was abit small....had we not had the option given to us we would have been happy enough because it's only a base to put your head. We booked this hotel based on the reviews and the price. We were not disappointed and I felt safe and secure. I took advantage of the pastries at breakfast and the coffee foc supplied from 9am....nice touch. The staff were sooo helpful...all of them well done and nothing was too much effort.....we will be back because the cleanliness and friendliness was worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Christmas break to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Mother141254
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed in a room with 2 doubles. Very clean. Not big but enough room and comfortable. Complimentary breakfast pastries, muffins, coffee, tea very good no dining area but just collect and take to your room no problem. Staff very helpful, polite and courteous even found us a corkscrew to open our wine! Convenient to subway, buses or short walk to all the sights. Bars and food just next door. Tea/coffee facilities in room would be a nice addition and perhaps some juice on breakfast buffet. Excellent value for money. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in nyc”
Reviews.Author: debbie05401
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a boutique style hotel in a great location near great eats and subway this is it. Stayed over the holiday's and originally from NY so aware of lots of hotels in the area. Small but typical rooms for the city but very clean without bed bugs. Staff was fantastic the most friendly and helpful ever. Parking can be $$ so look on street. Hot coffee and yummy pastry/muffins offered each morning. Room cost not bad if you go on line. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “9 nights at The MAve in Dec 2011 at NYC”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth_HM
Reviews.Content: Just had my first holiday in NYC. Stayed at The MAve for 9 nights. After some research done and based on the comments at Tripadvisor, I booked a single room for 9 nights in August. Let me give a summary of the pros and cons of The MAve: Pros: - Good service given by the staff in general. All staff is courteous and helpful. Especially Pablo and Armando, they were extremely patient in giving directions to restaurants and stores like Holister, A&F and Macy's. Pablo gave me several suggestions for dinner and suggested that I should purchase a 2-day hop on and off bus tour to have a better overview of the city. - Room is clean. The staff who cleaned my room did a marvelous job. Toiletries and towels are replaced. - Bed is comfortable - Walking distance to Macy's and Time Square. I did a lot of walking and hardly use the subway. You need a pair of good walking shoes if you want to visit NYC. - Nearby subway (line 6) - can take line 6 to 59th Street Lexington Ave and walk to 5th Ave and Madison Ave for shopping - Easy to use coffee machine in the room. You can also have a nice cup of hot black or green tea in the room. -Shake Shack - can take a 5 min walk to Shake Shack for a nice burger. This is the place that you must go to for a burger when you are in NYC. Cons: - The aircon in the room is noisy - Room is not soundproof - you could be woken up by the garbage truck in the morning. - Breakfast items were the same throughout my stay at the hotel. Don't expect varieties. You will be fine if you don't mind muffins and croissant for breakfast. Nevertheless, the coffee served at the breakfast area is good. On the whole, I think it is value for money. I will go back to The MAve when I am back in NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a hotel by its construction”
Reviews.Author: itsybitsyty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 24th birthday. Very clean, cutesy boutique hotel. Don't be deceived by the outside, it's pretty modern inside. The staff was nice enough to provide us with a city map, umbrellas, and 20% for the brunch place a few blocks down. The rooms are kind of small, but no biggie if it's only you and one other person. Who actually stays in their rooms when they are in NYC, right? Close to Eataly and Madison Square Park.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern hotel in great location, but service was average”
Reviews.Author: imoani
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while I was in NYC with some friends. I had my own room and took advantage of the 5th night free offer, so I felt it was quite good value. The room was on the 9th floor and was quite small but adequate considering I wasn't spending much time in there anyway! Pros: very clean and new, lovely bathroom, free wifi, comfy bed, breakfast included (see below). Cons: only one elevator in operation, which was quite small, fitting only about 4 people (without luggage). Sometimes I had extensive waits (especially at breakfast time) and took the stairs instead. There wasn't a fridge in the room either, and I would have liked to have been able to keep milk/drinks cold. Also there was a lot of traffic noise. My room looked over 27th St and at times it was really noisy with honking and trucks. I wore earplugs to bed. The breakfast each morning consisted of coffee, assorted pastries and muffins. If you want a more substantial breakfast there are a number of cafes and delis nearby. If there had been a fridge in the room I would have kept milk in there so I could have eaten cereal for breakfast and taken a muffin for a morning snack! The hotel is in a very central location, close to subways and within walking distance of a number of attractions such as Union Sq, Empire State Building, Macy's, Madison Sq. Park etc. Overall I was happy with my stay at the MAve but if I return to NYC again I would probably choose to stay in the hotel I stayed at during my first visit. This is mainly because I found some of the staff members at the MAve to have a bit of an attitude. Perhaps this is a consequence of living in a large stressful city?

Reviews.Title: “My business trip stay in the Mave”
Reviews.Author: Alfred P
Reviews.Content: It is incredible how better and at ease I felt from second one when I entred the premises of the Mave--- I met a friendly, nice looking and smiling youngh receptionist in the name of Pablo as he told me. For me, he went far beyond his daily duties when service me as a client. I saw him acting alike with all other incoming guests-- he made a huge difference. Great support, advise, guide, reassure and always made himself available to address guests concern so that they enjoy their stay at the Mave. I would sincery appreciate if such colleague could be recognized in the preformance of his duties.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place.”
Reviews.Author: artymom
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a nice stay at the Mave. It is a little off the beaten path compared to our usual places that we stay. But it is a up and coming location and very near the Flatiron district and all kinds of transportation is near and within walking distance. The room and bathroom was clean, quiet and more than adequate. The staff was polite and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “THE MAVE, NYC”
Reviews.Author: Kevin B
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Mave was most enjoyable! Everything from first greeting to checkout was superb; the perfect spot for a NYC vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: sarah a
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night before arriving at MAVE at Hilton in midtown and had a room twice the size with two beds, bigger bath etc., and some might say better location for nearly same price. Seems that a lot of Europeans have found MAVE and may not realize it's somewhat overpriced (hence overly positive reviews or maybe they get package deals) I think you can do better. Staff is friendly and generally helpful, rooms clean and sort of efficieny style, but I think overall not worth the price. The one time I asked for help getting a cab none was to be had -- "just go out on Madison Ave" and hail one yourself.... I do know how to do that, but I had a lot of luggage and thought it wasn't an unreasonable request. Oh well, I would probably not stay at MAVE again...

Reviews.Title: “Love the Location”
Reviews.Author: Forbiddens
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Two Full Bed this October. I like the location, it near Flariton Building and Union Square, Empire State Building. Taxi cost to Downtown and Time Square around $10-15. I also like that they have free hi-speed WiFi in the room. The room was clean. I praise the staff. They are informative and friendly. The free breakfast is just Ok. Muffin, bread and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique, Perfect Location, Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ahappyone
Reviews.Content: The perfect location, reasonable price for NYC, over-the-top staff! The staff made the expensively, simple, small room worth it!! Very clean room. The thin windows give you the perfect sound of the busiest city in the northeast!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience, deceptive information”
Reviews.Author: msk_900
Reviews.Content: The hotel shows deceptive information, 1. there are no in-room massages as they claim, 2. there is no parking for the hotel i had to park on the street, 3. the gym is one treadmill and some free weights, 4. TV is 27 inch not 32 and there are no free in-room movies only cable, 5. room service comes from a restaurant outside the hotel and has very limited hours, 6. they stated that in case of no-show the first night's price is deducted, however i booked 2 nights and decided to check out after one night and they said there is a one night cancellation fee which was not mentioned and which does not exist in any hotel i've heard of, after arguing and talking about all the deceptive information they gave they decided to waive the fee., 7. the room type i booked was not available and they gave me a smaller room and asked to change the room on the second night., 8. there is no fridge in the room and breakfast is a joke. coffee, bagels, crackers and cheese, nothing actually hot as they claimed but the coffee., 9. Queen room has a one person bed 140 cm wide., 10. they have someone who's job is to open the door but will not even help you carry your bags to the room., 11. there are no curtains in the room the sun shines on your face in the morning and the air conditioner is small noisy and smelly. 12. the hotel's overall cleanliness is very poor with almost everything damaged and poorly painted and rooms are the smallest in NYC., 13. the hotel is extremely overpriced, i moved to the Intercontinental Times Square for almost the same price. I can not believe the excellent reviews i read about this hotel, they must have been at a different hotel or written by the hotel's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice contemporary lobby, tiniest room I have ever seen in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Vincent_St-Maurice
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the Flat Iron district, close to subway lines. Lobby looks nice, modern and clean. Staff is friendly and helpful. But the room, so tiny. I know hotel rooms are small in NYC unless you're ready to pay a fortune, but come on. We could hardly move in the room, and we had next to no luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the MAve - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ali T
Reviews.Content: The MAve is a wonderful hotel in the heart of Manhattan! We were on a business trip in NYC, shooting for a magazine, had so many troubles with messengers, FedEx, etc, but the crew of the hotel were EXTREMELY helpful, they solved all of our problems! The room was incredible clean!!! Many thanks for making our stay perfect!

Reviews.Title: “The Mave Hotel, New York City”
Reviews.Author: ktattoo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online a couple of months in advance. Booking went very well, got the confirmation e-mail with all the info and the price. No surprises when checked out. The Mave hotel has really great location, has nice & clean rooms (that contain just enough for your stay - nothing less nothing more), great service and very friendly and helpfull staff. Free wifi available. Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and can only recommend it. When we'll plan our next visit to New York, I certainly will book again at The Mave hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Were amazingly helpful during Hurricane Irene”
Reviews.Author: sarah5320
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 5 nights stay here but unfortunately were due to fly home the day the hurricane hit. As a result our flight was cancelled and couldn't fly out for another 6 days. The hotel allowed us to remain in our room ( which had been upgraded on arrival to a king) for a reduced rate. Luckily we managed to get an earlier flight and only needed the two exta nights, there was no problem cancelling the extra nights we provisionally booked. They were patient as we tried to find the extra money to pay for the room. The hotel is in a good location, close to subway stops. The Flatiron building is right near by, the Empire State Building is a five minute walk, times square a little further. We even walked to central park one day. The room had everything we needed including fast wifi! Parts of the room were a little worn around the edges but it was modern, fresh and clean. The room was a king size and an ok size but that's standard for the area. It was perfectly adequate but upgrading to a king would be worth the money. I can imagine the queen is a little small. The breakfast was a nice idea but didn't work for me, by the time I got there at 08:30 it was demolished. You either have to squeeze standing up in the Lobby area or take it back to the room. But it is complementary so can't really complain. Even though there is no restaurant on site they do provide room service from a nearby restaurant, never tried it but menu looked promising. In summary the service was fantastic and it made a good base for exploring the city. Good budget accommodation. Again thank you to the reception staff for being very helpful at a stressful time. It made things so much easier to know we at least had accomodation organised. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for a NY break”
Reviews.Author: pompeywanderer
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting a luxurious hotel with lots of pampering, and that's exactly what I got. This is a basic, clean, well located hotel in Manhattan. Our room had two double beds and a bathroom with a shower (no bath). The room was on the small side, only about 2 feet between the beds, which were pushed up against the walls, but as all we needed was somewhere clean to sleep after a full day out I have no complaints. The Hotel is located about 30minutes walk from Time Square, and just around the corner from a subway station. The breakfast consisted of pastries and coffee served on a table in the reception area - no seating, no tables, but was more than adequate. There was no problem with taking the food back up to your room. The staff were really helpful and happy to help in any way they could. We requested a coffee maker and fridge for our room (not standard) which they provided free of charge. There is no kitchen at the MAve, although any food you want can be ordered in from a local cafe. Would be prepared to stay here again if in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Below Par...”
Reviews.Author: WiseTraveler1974
Reviews.Content: I think the Mave is in a good location. It's very central to many places. Nonetheless, it has only 2 small elevators (one of which was broken during my stay), and no formal lobby. The included breakfast was basically put out in the hallway.. not a good vibe. They'd be better not offering breakfast. They offer miniscule rooms .. and being that this is Manhattan it was understandable and effectively the bed was comfortable. The Mave isn't bad... it's just not good and for the price doesn't come across as a value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: HKFoodie
Reviews.Content: I tried this boutique hotel based on tripadvisor reviews. The location is great, only one short block to the subway stop (Lexington line 23rd stop). At $200 p.n. (inc tax), the room size was acceptable (Madison type). Decor is modern & simple. On the negative, no refrigerator in the room, and window air-conditioning which is a bit loud. I was on a lower floor so you could hear the traffic as windows are not double glaze. Only one of the two elevators was working so if you are on an upper floor, you have to wait a long time. The hotel provides complimentary pastries and coffee in the front lobby which is good but many of the guests hangout by the tables giving the feel like you are a fast food restaurant. I think there are plenty of new boutique hotels that have opened in NYC for around $200-250 p.n. (inc tax) so I will try another hotel for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fun boutique hotel - always a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Mfgib197
Reviews.Content: Have actually stayed ath the MAve several times (probably 4 or 5) and had a good experience each time. Location is very good (tucked in a quieter, clean area of Chelsea), staff has a can-do attitude (they've accommodated me for early check-in more than once over the years), the lobby is inviting, and the hotel appointments are quirky, sort of an industrial kitsch motif. The breakfast on the run is fun, with a good assortment of pastry and cheese and the like (but no real beverages for some reason). Rooms are quite cozy and watch out for the step up going into many of the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renowated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank_Jr_II
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the MAve for three nights and liked it very much. The minimalist interior design was really pleasant. The location was great. Our room was quite small and we had a lot of problem handling our three big bags. They didnt have a breakfast saloon but rather served some danish pasties in grab-and-go style.

Reviews.Title: “Some of the best service in the city”
Reviews.Author: BobSassani
Reviews.Content: Room was great just what i needed, service was where the value is. from my Desires welcome note to amenities, all people here and what they do for guests are 1st class. Do not forget this gem when visiting The Apple

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back! Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: PedroM84
Reviews.Content: The MAve is a charming and modern boutique hotel on the corner of Madison Ave with 27th St, a few steps from 5th avenue and Madison Square Park (one of the many fabulous NYC parks). Need I say more? The staff is incredibly nice, welcoming and helpful; always willing and available to do their best at fulfilling your Desires. As soon as you pass the front door, you can't help but feel welcome to the place, as you are promptly greeted by one or two staff members (gotta mention the nice scent in the lobby and the equally pleasant chill-out/lounge music coming from the speakers), combined with the hotel's hip and fresh mood, making you feel like you are ready to conquer NYC and truly enjoy the best of it. Getting to The MAve was the perfect start! Not to mention the complimentary early check-in we got, which made our day after a nine hour flight from Brazil. The rooms are nicely decorated, enough to give it a clean casual modern look; it's always neat and clean when you come back at the end of the day with your legs sore from exploring the city, the beds are truly comfy (great mattresses and covers!), and yes, there is silence. In the city that never sleeps, you'll certainly get the best night's sleep. PLUS: YouÂ´ll get complimentary (high-speed!) wi-fi and grab-and-go breakfest; a couple of subway stations at short-walking distance; nearby Starbucks, Bread and Butter, Duane Reade for all your basic needs; great restaurants and not-to-miss places like Eataly, Shake Shack, Flatiron Building, and much talked about rooftops like 230 Fifth Avenue. Have recommended to friends and family, and definitely looking forward to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: skinnyglassesgirl
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very clean and in a good location. The staff was very helpful and friendly and were always smiling. The room was small, but nicely decorated and had all of the amenities you would need. The beds were comfy. It is a nice, trendy hotel that I would recommend for couples, friends, for business. Also, we had to get room service one evening and it was quite tasty!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: sandieck
Reviews.Content: I got a really good deal through Travelzoo. I had a larger king room on the street side that was nice, comfy, and clean. The staff was very nice. The breakfast wasn't much to speak of, just muffins and coffee. I had a room on the second floor during a hot week. The AC is a noisy window unit and the windows don't keep out much noise, so be sure to bring your earplugs. The shower has no control for pressure, so you better like full pressure in your shower. The shower head is a modern style large head with a straight down stream, fine for me but I know my daughter would have hated it. There is room service from a nearby restaurant. The TV has a million channels with HBO and there is free wireless internet. I would stay again, as long as I have earplugs ;)

Reviews.Title: “My absolute favorite hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: tbq21
Reviews.Content: My absolute favorite hotel in New York. This was my 2nd stay and I will be back, thatÂ´s for sure. When I came back this year after been to Las Vegas (Caesars Palace, great hotel) and Miami (Townhouse also a great hotel) it really felt like coming home and I love The Mave and I love New York . ItÂ´s nothing that I would like to change at this hotel. It's really nice and clean. The service is excellent, everything from getting you a cab til helping you with direction to a event or something, in my case was direction to a baseball game at Yankee Stadium by train. They are always friendly at the front desk, 24/7. The room is great and I love the bed. In the morning they put a news paper outside your door. They serv a continental breakfast (itÂ´s ok). The room itÂ´s really "quiet", you donÂ´t hear the neighbors. They have a alarm clock with a Ipod dock so you donÂ´t need to bring your own speakers, thanks for that. For me is The Mave located central, 3-4 blocks from Empire State Building, 10 min from Time Square (walking distance). McDonalds, subway and a Duane Reade (or is it CVS or Rite Aid ) just one two streets away. Maybe one thing that I miss actually, I would like to have a small fridge in the room, that would be nice, maybe they have it for my next staying. I really recomends this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BleuChanel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good for a business trip in Manhattan, the hotel staff was amazing, and the room service was good. The sleep quality was good, the cleanliness was not bad, the morning breakfast could be better, unfortunately no spa or swimming pool, but I guess you won't need these in a business trip. On a few occasions, the towels were dirty. I recommend this hotel, however, I might be looking for another one for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location...kinda trendy...a bit above average”
Reviews.Author: spls76
Reviews.Content: Just completed a two night stint here. Paid for the larger broadway king (260sq ft room) and it was cool but cool in a way where you are trying to make something old look new. Floors were dirty. Windows filthy and a misty water smell was masked by a awesome bed, great bathroom and nice decor. Location was great as two subway stops were a block away on either direction and your on madison ave!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: mel_g13
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in unusually cold march. I loved this hotel. The room was surprisingly big and really clean! The bed was huge and very very comfortable. The hotel provides everything u need toiletries, coffee machine, maps etc. The reception staff were very helpful and even recommended and booked us a restaurant on our first night. The location was also brilliant we walked everywhere. It is very close to the flatiron building, empire state and times square! We wanted somewhere which was nice for a good price and I have to say that I was very very happy that we chose this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Katverf
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short trip to NYC. Stayed for four nights at the Mave. (Room 804) Room was small but tidy. First night we had a lot of noise from the street because of the festivities near Madison Square Park. Other nights the noise level was acceptable. Grab and Go breakfast was good. Excellent central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locatation,”
Reviews.Author: Plasmasgal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Mum for a birthday celebration, her 50th my 21st. Let's starts at the beginning, we arrived 3 hours past check in due to our flight been delayed and were taken straight too our room and given maps of the area and the times of breakfast. The room was an ok size, 2 double beds with enough room to just about walk round in. The room was opposite the lift, this is something did not bother us at all. Over the 5 nights we stayed we never heard it. On the other hand the traffic noise was really loud, it seemed like the window didn't quiet shut properly and we could hear everything! BUT after our days out and about we were so tired, we didnt have a problem sleeping at all! Breakfast was ok, a deffinate grab and go. We took ours back up too our room too eat, which was a little difficult but we managed it! On a few mornings we went to the local dinar and had amazing breakfasts. The location was amazing, right on the corner of Madison Avenue, everything we wanted was right on our door step! We had a really great time and all the staff were fab! Even sorting out a coffee machine for my mum who wanted to pack a kettle. I would defiantly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Handily Placed, Reasonable Value for Manhattan, too noisy”
Reviews.Author: mackiep
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay here last week. It's in a very good location in midtown Manhattan. Staff were helpful and the room was a decent size for a mid price Boutique hotel. I have stayed around the corner at the Gershwin before and, given the choice would opt for the latter. Breakfast, a grab and go affair, isn't really worth it. There is a great diner on 5th, a short walk away, where I often stop for breakfast in Manhattan, and you can eat well there for ten bucks. There's a great coffee bar at the Gershwin which is a short walk away too. Late checkouts weren't available, which is a real pain for transatlantic customers, most of whom have to catch evening or night flights. As has been noted elsewhere this is a very noisy hotel. I had ear plugs which meant I slept well, the bed was great, and I would advise anyone staying here to do the same. The irritating Aircon has also been commented on - I switched it off, but in July and August that is unlikely to be an option.

Reviews.Title: “Compact, very clean, with first class matress and bedding, immaculate bathroom, and all necessary amenities.”
Reviews.Author: GMC056
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the MAve twice in the last few months and both times have been impressed by the cleanliness of the rooms, immaculate bathrooms, and conveniences like the free Internet connection, plasma TV, bathrobe, ironing board, and toiletries. I was particularly impressed by the beds (and bed linens): the matresses are extraordinarily comfortable (I actually decided to buy a new mattress after my first trip) and the linens are high quality. The MAve is very well situated, just down the street from the Flat Iron building, Madison Square Gardens, and numerous restaurants. There are also delis and other small convenience stores within easy walking distance. The staff were friendly, efficient and available. I also liked the continental breakfasr with a selection of fruit, pastries, tea and coffeee. I would (and already have) recommended the hotel to colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Above average, great value”
Reviews.Author: tdottony
Reviews.Content: This hotel was formally the Madison Hotel which was my go to choice as a budget mined traveller. Under the new banner, the hotel has a modern flare and and obviously the newness of a new hotel. The mid-town location is very convenient and in light walking distance up and down Broadway Ave. The price point for the city cannot be beaten. Its quaint and the rooms can be on the smaller size, so spend the extra couple of dollars and go for the mid-size room at minimum. Very good service levels. Highly recommended for a three star experience, which for NYC is quite good . Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Things Come in Small Packages"”
Reviews.Author: lagunabookworm
Reviews.Content: Location/Price: My company's main office is in SoHo, so I was pleased to find a hotel that was a short subway ride away and for under $220/night. The location on 27th and Madison is excellent and a short walk to Madison Square Park, which is one of the greener small parks in NYC--lots of hyacinths and a great hamburger/shake stand. There are lots of good restaurants near the hotel and the staff provides you with a list and short description of each upon check in. The Hotel Lobby: This is a tall, narrow hotel---clean with a sleek, contemporary design and petite. This isn't one of your same/old, same/old chains, and the staff pay attention to the little details. For example, they send you an email before you arrive to see what kind of drink and nibbles you would like to have in your room upon check in---all complimentary. The Room: I'm a light sleeper and find street noise an issue, so I switched from the larger room I had reserved facing 27th to one in the back---all done without any problem. The room was small, but ingeniously designed with all the necessities: good drawer space, a desk with free internet, a double or queen bed with a very comfortable mattress and nice linens, a good-sized shower with high-end toiletries (great scent), and excellent lighting in the bathroom for applying make-up. The hair dryer was under the sink in a roll-out drawer---another example of the clever use of small spaces. There's even a petite gym on the top floor of the hotel, which was nice since the space was a bit tight for doing yoga. The Staff: They were wonderful, always ready to help, gave great advice on places to eat and things to see, and were very friendly. They made everything feel personal rather than routine---greeting you on the way out in the morning and upon your return at night. Some of the best service I've ever had in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: johnsmith65
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at The MAve for a business trip. Front desk staff was genuinely friendly and very helpful, offering restaurant recommendations and even letting me borrow a charger for my iPhone. Free continental breakfast offered a nice selection. Rooms have great high-end finishes and are very clean and comfortable. Will absolutely stay here again. Great value and an outstanding location.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel on Madison”
Reviews.Author: BastienPhotography
Reviews.Content: The Mave was the old Madison Hotel that was just renovated. The rooms are very small, but very clean and very nice modern furniture and design. The staff is small, but very friendly. The continental breakfast was not much to talk about. Croissants, muffins, fruits, coffee, etc. If you get there the last hour, you might miss most of the stuff like I did. One drawback is the 2 old elevators. One was out of service and the other one was very slow. Over all if you need to stay in the lower mid town area at an affordable price, this is a good choice. Clean comfortable rooms, with no trills.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel! Great staff, location and value.”
Reviews.Author: AllyT07
Reviews.Content: My first visit to New York was this year in February. A friend and I stayed at The Mave for two weeks and I really love this hotel! I was so impressed during my stay at The Mave. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, always ready to help with directions, maps, recommendations or making reservations. It's very rare to find a hotel that makes your stay as comfortable as you would be at home, but The Mave manages to do it! The complimentary light breakfast is also a great inclusion. The rooms are really clean, modern, well maintained and the beds are so comfortable. The location is ideal, The Mave is really close to the subway, which makes it so easy to visit all the different areas of Manhattan. Overall it was an absolute pleasure to stay at The Mave and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Stephyeng
Reviews.Content: I travelled to New York for the long weekend in February with four ladies for a weekend of shopping and eating. I came across The MAve during a random hotel search and decided to take a chance on this new hotel. Having never been to NYC I wasnt sure what to expect. I had heard stories of small, cramped, noisey NYC hotels but I am happy to say that I experienced non of the above at the MAve. The rooms were a great size, clean, and very modern and the beds were unbelievably comfortable. We heard very little noise from the street, no more than you would here in Toronto where we are from. The continental breakfast was nice and front desk staff were very helpful and attentive. The location was also fantastic, a short walj to the Empire State Building, around the corner from the Flatiron Building and right between two subway stops. Overall our stay was great and I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to the city - familes, friends, couples.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelhound
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights during weekly business in NYC. Location is super although I had walked past the hotel many times during previous visits and never noticed it. Check-in was quick and very efficient in the intimate lobby. Only one elevator during my stay but it was fast plus the stairway is open and very convenient. I was given a room on the Fifth floor right next to the stairs so I was concerned about noise however I never heard a sound from the halls which was an extremely pleasant surprise. Room was a basic square with king bed and hardwood floors. Temperature was very good although the unit was loud. Bathroom located right next to the door --- small in size but everything was extremely clean and the walk-in shower was well designed so that surprising little water collected outside the opening. I also appreciated the drawer in the bathroom vanity -- excellent for stowing toiletries out of the way. Because I was a registered member of the Desire Hotels loyalty club, two cans of soda and two snacks were waiting for me along with a welcome note from the staff. Desk was next to the bed and was a good size. Lighting was either an overhead fixture or two bedside fixtures -- very good for reading in bed. I also really appreciated having the television station listing so easily available on the desk --- sometimes so hard to find the specific program you are looking for. Bed was loaded with pillows and a nice down comforter --- unfortunately there was a stain right at the top of the comforter -- looked like coffee but who knows. Also wireless was free and strong signal. Bed itself was very comfortable and would have thought a good night sleep was in order however the street noise was terrible even though the rooms overlook 27th and not Madison Ave. Sirens until very late at night and delivery trucks starting at about 5 in the morning. They also offer a complimentary grab-and-go continental breakfast in the lobby in the morning which was a nice perk however a little difficult to navigate all of the rolling luggage. My final impression is that this is a good budget choice --- room was clean and basic --- especially if you are a heavy sleeper. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend - great for small children!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaFam
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Mave twice with our 2 children (ages 6 and 4) and we love this hotel! The price is so reasonable that it makes you want to do more trips to NYC! The staff is wonderful and they make you feel so at home. The free breakfast in the morning is a delight and a huge perk. The coffee and danishes are wonderful. Our room was immaculate. They are a bit small, but for the amount of time we stayed in the room, it was cozy and relaxing. The location of this hotel is a dream...you can get anywhere quickly and Madison Square Park is right next door...perfect for the kids! This hotel is a gem. We had no problem with noise...our kids slept in every morning. Definitely a great value for a clean, groovy hotel with a quaint feel.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected perks but iffy sleep in a great location”
Reviews.Author: brooklyngal
Reviews.Content: This brand new modern hotel on the corner of 27th Street and Madison Avenue is convenient to the subway, lots of restaurants, Madison Square Park, and the Empire State Building. Staff is friendly and helpful, and the rooms are attractive, in a minimal unfussy way, and tidy. Our room (701) was also very small, which was expected, especially at under $110/night. Though the bed is firm, it's comfortable enough, with not a bedbug in sight. No bath, just a shower, with fairly low pressure, though it gets nice and hot. The real problem is the noise: our room faced the avenue, which is well traveled by taxis and Mack trucks. Also, the heating/AC unit in the window sounded like a jet taking off, and the air in the room was extremely dry, causing real discomfort. We solved our problems with (1) earplugs from Walgreens and (2) soaking a towel in water and hanging it on the dresser in front of the roaring heater, thereby getting a little humidity. Unexpected perks for the price: free wifi (YES!), fitness center and complimentary breakfast. No bar, but they may be building one soon. The 6 train took us nearly everywhere we wanted to go (museums uptown, Century 21 shopping downtown) and the restaurants nearby seemed inexhaustible. I'd definitely consider this hotel again if the price was right, but if it got more expensive I'd prefer a B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - excellent service, great value, and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: From_here_to_there
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the MAve Hotel twice (for several nights each time) in the span of several weeks in January, and I would enthusiastically recommend it. I'm a frequent traveler and am usually more inclined to complain about hotels than to praise them, but this hotel earned my enthusiasm, so I wanted to highlight it. As others have noted, the service was consistently excellent - the kind that you would expect at a hotel three times this price, but rarely found in New York at any price. I was on crutches at the time, and the staff went out of their way to help. I think that the MAve offers unparalleled value for money in New York: the rooms are decent sized (although I should add that I stayed in a king room), are furnished in a modern style and offer all the amenities that a visitor could need, and there were none of the problems that so often plague New York hotels (the free wireless worked perfectly, there was always hot water, the air-conditioning/heating worked and didn't generate much noise, etc.). Although some others have complained about the breakfast, it worked perfectly for me - the chance to grab a couple of croissants (of different types and good quality) on the way out the door is what I want when I'm in town for business. Moreover, as others have noted, the location is excellent. I plan to return to the hotel and would definitely recommend it to visitors to New York. I'd also recommend that potential visitors check out their website, which offers some good deals.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon and new years eve in new york”
Reviews.Author: vincentemilie_france
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an hotel in the middle of manhattan for our honeymoon. The mave nyc is very well located just 10 minutes by feet from times square, between madison avenue and broadway. The breakfast is delicious, the staff is always here to help us, even at 1 am (I tried it !). The boulevard room is perfect, the king size bedroom is so cumfortable. We've already planned to come back in new york city and we won't look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry guys - but you were below standard”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: Firstly, let me say up front that the people on the front desk were really friendly and very helpful. If it were not for them, then I would have to give this hotel only 2 stars. We booked a room with a queen size bed - well the bed was queen, but the room was most definitely not! Even by NYC standards (and I have stayed there many times) this room was small, with a tiny bathroom. Please be aware that the pics shown on the hotel website and many of the web portals is the Penthouse suite on the top floor, and shows absolutely no resemblance to the room we were shown into. The hotel offered to show us another room (which to be fair was marginally better, but still very disappointing). So we had no real alternative but to upgrade ourselves to the larger room featured on their website (at a ADDITIONAL cost of $125 per night + tax). So, at that point we thought we were settled - wrong! There were no instructions for the air conditioning units, so we tried for hours to get some heat before giving up and calling reception. The guys were helpful and we achieved some warmth within the half hour. Other stuff - the safe was not secured down at all (we could have just walked off with it! - so we had to carry valuables with us everywhere we went (not ideal - especially in NYC). The "power shower" wasn't (only half the shower heads actually worked). The room was on the 12th floor (so no traffic noise) but only one of the two elevators was working for a significant part of our stay (so we often had to wait for an age to get to our room). Breakfast - well forget it - it is a joke! A few bread rolls and pastries and some juice and coffee, served on a table at the back of reception, which you had to take back to your room to eat as there was no space to stand. Half the reception was being renovated, although we never saw anyone working on it during all the time we were there. Last adverse comment to make - if you are used to large fluffy bath towels - forget it. The biggest towels available to us were large size hand towels. Oh yes - and only one bath robe was provided - why?! All in all a disappointing stay, rescued only by the professionalism of those on the front desk. Well done to you, but we will not be returning to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: WeeGio
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 6 nights and found the hotel brilliant in every way! the reception staff were really friendly and helpfull, and as the reception is manned 24 hours it felt safe! the hotel rooms were great, we stayed in the madison king room and it was a good size with space for luggage etc and the bed was the comfiest bed i have ever slept in!! the room, toilet and hotel in general were kept really clean and the housekeeping staff were friendly. The hotel is in a great position, right beside 5th avenue and the empire state building! Close to a friendly wee bar called "Desmonds" on the next street beside les halles (Bourdain's old resturaunt!) which by the way does awsome steaks!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel....Staff is super friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: ppeebles
Reviews.Content: We are from Dallas and have been to NYC several times. We stayed at the MAVE Hotel for the 2010 Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. We found the hotel to be of good value. It was clean and beds confortable...but the biggest surprise was the staff at the front desk. They were young and hip. They gave us great suggestions on where to eat and visit. The hotel is fairly new. It doesn't have a bar or restaurant; but it is perfect to use if you want to stay in NYC and use it to pivot to other activities within the city. I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for low maintenance traveler”
Reviews.Author: ChuckandNeil
Reviews.Content: Have been to NYC several times. Stayed in $$$$ and $ hotels. I found this was the best value for my dollar. I am not looking for spa treatments or the like. I look for a clean comfortable stylish place to rest my bones at the end of a day of exploring. A great deal in a central location of Manhattan. Clean rooms - tight on space - but totally manageable. Great staff - informed recommendations for food and fun. Breakfast.....pastries and coffee. Nowhere to consume, but do big deal. Comfortable bed. Nice linens. Stayed on third floor, didn't notice excessive noise (nothing more than usual for NYC). Odd bathroom configuration, but chic nonetheless. Have recommended this to friends who have enjoyed as well. Our demographics - 30-45 Downtown Toronto Travel 5-6 times a year (Europe/All Inclusive/Canada/USA)

Reviews.Title: “Two sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: aycdc
Reviews.Content: The window AC unit was so loud, I was able to get about 2-3-hour sleep during my 2-night stay. It blows constantly. When reaches certain temperature, it switches to cold. I tried to turn it off in the middle of the night but the room gets very cold quickly. The bathroom was very cold since the heat does not reach it. I always try to stay in unique, boutique-style places rather than in a hotel chain. But this place is way too uncomfortable. The only positive I can mention is that the people working there were very nice. Will not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Amazing service particularly from Mayerlin & Maureen! Thank you my stay was great and would highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Other than a small hiccup when I arrived (heating wasn't on/working) I was quickly moved (& upgraded) to an incredibly comfortable room, fantastic bed & WIFI, extremely clean and cannot fault the service. The hotel has this great "Desires" program and Mayerlin booked and researched tours for me before I'd even arrived! Extremely personal & knowledgeable front desk staff, nothing was too much trouble, great restaurant info and other helpful info for a traveller! Even a note from my room attendant wishing me a safe onward journey! I would highly recommend this place-make sure you ask for an upper floor though I was in 206 and it was a bit noisy early morning (briefly) and the heater was a little noisy but everything else was comfortable, warm friendly staff at every interaction-will stay again when next in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in (nearly) every way”
Reviews.Author: WMD2009
Reviews.Content: We'd spent a long amount of time looking at hotels that met our criteria - location being top of the agenda - when we stumbled across the MAve. The staff are all so friendly and helpful - they were great from arrival through to us leaving, with check-in and out being really quick and efficient. We were pleasantly surprised to find out there was a small buffet of coffee and pastries available at breakfast (7.00-9.00) as we weren't aware of this when booking. It's served at the far end of the lobby rather than in a restaurant (as the hotel doesn't have one). It was a little crowded if a few residents were down at the same time, but we tended to grab what we wanted and took it back to the room. Only one lift was in operation during our stay, but we only used it for taking our luggage up to the room and back down again on the departure day. The rest of the time we used the stairs, which were absolutely fine, being only 3 floors up. The room was smaller than we expected for a king size, but had everything we needed - the lighting is great, it's kept very clean and the shower was fantastic!! The only issue was road noise on an evening - as we were out exploring every day, we tended to sleep through it but it was quite loud (though the AC unit did tend to compete!) Location-wise, we couldn't have asked for any better - it was literally about 10mins walk to Times Square. We walked up up Central Park a few times too, using the subway a few times to get downtown. Tips for NYC generally - we purchased express tickets in advance for the ESB. There were zero queues on the day, but it did look like it could be an absolutely mare if you picked a busy day! Nearly everything on sale in the gift shop is double anywhere else. 5th Ave was awful on the Saturday (not sure if it's just xmas shoppers...) - not good for taking children as you can easily lose party members - much better on a Sunday. Metrocards for the subway can be bought on the platform at Grand Central (not sure about the smaller subway stops). We got 4 trips for Â£8 which was plenty as you can change lines as much as you need to and only pay for one trip as long as you don't exit a station.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Kaileysue3331
Reviews.Content: I selected the MAVE because it was close to my business meeting location and because it did not have any reports of bedbugs. It seems the larger chain hotels were having issues...enough said. I'm so glad I choose well! The Mave was immaculate, modern and tidy. The great location made it easy to walk anywhere. Loved the shower and the King bed. Yes, the rooms are a bit smaller and there's a bit of street noise, but I hardly noticed. Heat was good and staff was excellent. I may never stay at a larger hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ISW
Reviews.Content: After searching for quite some time for an affordable NY hotel in a good location, I stumbled upon the MAve. Booking directly via their website, I got a very reasonable rate, and was pleasantly surprised when my booking was followed up by the question which kind of complimentary snack and drink I'd like to get when I arrive. I also think it was a very nice touch that they sent me an e-mail a few days before arrival asking if there was anything else the could do for me (this was the first time any hotel did that). Upon arrival, everything worked smooth and the stuff was very friendly. My request for a late check-out was immediatly honoured (2 days in advance, instead of the usual "same day hassle"). The room was much nicer than expected - quite large (especially for NY standards), hardwood floor (with a carpet just below the bed), very clean and stylishly furnished. The bathroom, featureing a large "rain forrest"-type shower, was also nice. Further highlights: a complementary bathrobe, and the free WiFi worked like a charm :-) The heating in the room worked nice and fast; the only drawback of the room was that the windows could not be opened. The complimentary breakfast was "grab and go", with coffee and pastries on offer, but it ended at 9am (so I only tried it once ;-). The only slightly negative points I can think of was that there is just one (not very fast) elevator, and the floors and staircase look a bit dated - but considering the price and that the room was really good, I don't think that matters much. I also like the location - safe and central, with roughly the same walking distance north to central park and south to the financial district. Would definitly recommend this hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Avoid Cheap Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LXSEN
Reviews.Content: Had to switch from the Marcel at Gramercy, one of my favourites in the area, because Thanksgiving prices were shooting above 300 USD per night. The hotel has a nice attitude, its supposed to be a funky crash pad. Unfortunately the cheapest room I could find, at a hefty 250+ USD was a small hole in the wall. It was very clean but even on the highest floor it was just plain noisy because of the bad isolation. The A/C on lowest setting next to the bed was so noisy I had to resort to earplugs for the first time in well, lot of years. Speaking about the location it was great, its just that in NY I use rooms just to sleep, and if that is not restoring, well the entire stay unfortunately isnt. Perhaps the other rooms are better. Free high-speed internet. Free breakfast also, but could not find it (did not ask).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!! Believe all the good reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: LDN_Lady
Reviews.Content: Do not let the 3 stars put you off! It is better than some of the 4 and 5 star hotels found in Manhattan. A friend and I stayed on 25 November 2010 so that we could get to the Black Friday sales early the next day. PROS: - Helpful and polite staff giving a very personal service which is sometimes lacking in the larger chain hotels. They helped us with our bags to taxi, recommended restaurants, mueseums etc. - Good wifi connection availible in rooms and throughout the hotel. - Free continental breakfast (although no actual restaurant) - Room was quiet & very clean with some good facilities (iPod docking station, flat screen cable tv etc) - Beds are very comfortable. - The hotel is well located on Madison Avenue - a short walk to shopping areas, Empire State Building or the subway which can take you anywhere in New York. - Also a few blocks away is Madison Square Park which houses a great diner called the Shake Shack. CONS: - Rainfall shower not bad but would have liked for it to have been more powerful and for the water to have been hotter as it was just warm. - No coffee machine provided in our room despite it being advertised on the website. - Would also prefer the option of having tea AND coffee in the rooms as coffee is not everyone's preference - but I have found that it is difficult to find establishments in New York that serve tea anyway. - We got the "Urban room with a full sized bed" which is the most basic room at the hotel. This was adequate for my friend and I as we weren't really in the room much and we only had one suitcase each. It is quite a tight squeeze so I would recommend getting one of the larger rooms if you've got a lot of luggage etc. As this room size does not provide much space for your luggage or drawers/hangers to unpack you clothes into. Overall a really great hotel! I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliak7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mave several times and just love the hotel! The staff is amazing and helped me with everything I needed. I was welcomed to the hotel by the Director of Sales and Marketing who was super nice and got some one to help me with my suitcases right away. The room was very cozy and I felt no discomfort. The location of the hotel is great and there's a beautiful park near by where I enjoyed some great burgers that were recommended to me by the staff. The staff helped me book some tickets to a show I wanted to see and told me the most amazing spots in New York. I had An amazing time. I enjoyed my stay very much and will return to The Mave every time I visit New York!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent visit with Friendly Service, Convenient Location, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here during an October vacation to New York and were very satisfied with the location, cleanliness, service and overall experience at the MAve. The room was clean, comfortable, stylish and well-appointed, the staff were friendly and helpful. The location was excellent, near two subway stops, just a few blocks from the Empire State Building and the Morgan Library, among other destinations. The theater district was relatively nearby, and the MAve was a great, quiet place to 'come home' for a quiet night's rest. Though the continental breakfast is limited, The Birch cafe is a great coffee shop just down the street, and many ethnic restaurants are within a few blocks' walk. We got a 'Girls' package, and enjoyed the complimentary cheese, fruit and champagne delivered to our rooms, as well as a manicure at a shop just down the street. We would definitely stay at the MAve again.

Reviews.Title: “Listen to the good reviews!”
Reviews.Author: ShakalakaBaby
Reviews.Content: I always use Trip Advisor to see what hotels are like -- and because of that, I wanted to make sure people who were reading reviews about the MAve were not put off by what I consider to be "the perpetual moaners" (the people who moan for the sake of it and no other reason!). Yes, the MAve's rooms are small - it's a boutique hotel but seriously, do you go into New York City to sit in your room and look at four walls? The reception staff were fantastic, informative and pleasant - and when I filled in the after-care survey, the Front Office Manager emailed me back personally to thank me. It's rare for any hotel to offer such service, and I know this because I work in hotels myself. The bathrooms are spotless and the bath products smell lovely. The room has all that you would need and the beds were so comfortable with an abundance of pillows - 6 on a kingsize bed, I think. The cost is brilliant compared with other city centre hotels. Yes, there is noise from the street - but again, you are literally facing Madison Avenue and it would be foolish to think that you aren't going to hear something. Personally, it did not affect my sleep one bit. Great hotel, wonderful staff. Will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel with great breakfast pastries!!”
Reviews.Author: sharpnup
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at The Mave 4 Nights (Oct 16-19th 2010) Hotel is lovely and clean, with comfortable beds and plenty of room (Unlike some other NYC hotels) Hotel staff are incredibly friendly and helpful.-Recommended LOADS of good bars, restaurants (thank you for your help) Hotel provides breakfast in the rear lobby section of Croissants, Apple turnovers,Muffins,Apples and Coffee (Perfect way to start the day!) Rooms contain sizeable bed with comfortable duvet, Cable tv, Safe, open shower and free WIFI.-(Nice touch) Only downside I can give is our Room on Level 2 had single paned windows which allows traffic noise to be heard BUT saying that never kept me awake. Would DEFINITELY stay at The Mave again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for first visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: sthmcr
Reviews.Content: I booked the MAve as part of an Expedia package after a friend recommended it. I read a few of the reviews on TripAdvisor and went ahead and booked. Right from the moment I walked in, it was a fantastic experience. The staff were efficient, helpful and friendly, nothing seemed too much trouble. They offered to help us with dinner reservations, arranging taxis to the airport and stored our luggage securely and for free after we checked out on the last day and came back for it later on. I upgraded to a room with two double beds, and was impressed with the cleanliness, design, and features. Yes, the rooms are a little on the small side, but this is Manhattan. There was some light traffic noise at night, again, it's expected given the location. There was also no bath in the room we stayed in, this didn't bother me as there was a large walk in shower instead and the bathroom in particular was spotlessly clean. There was a handy in-room safe (inclusive), flatscreen cable TV with tons of channels, ironing facilities and room service available. We didn't need anything but it seemed that anything you wanted or needed, the staff would help you. I should also mention the complimentary breakfast; the pastries are great, although the reception area where it's served can get a bit crowded as it's quite popular with the guests. We stayed 3 nights, it was our first visit to New York and I couldn't fault the location. Walking around the area you feel much more like a local, it's quieter and much less touristy than Times Square, but still conveniently accessible to most places by the 2 subway stations within a 5 minute walk (28th Street on the 6 line just to the east and 28th Street on the N&R lines to the west). We ate out locally a couple of nights - the Park Avenue Bistro (which provides room service for the hotel) is particularly recommended, and the Shake Shack just down the road in Madison Square Park does great burgers in a fantastic setting. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay somewhere central and convenient, away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, and appreciates staying in a contemporary designed but also unpretentious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jo2527
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the mave for 6 nights in october,the hotel is very modern and clean staff are very friendly and helpful. it is in a really good location on madison avenue corner of 27th 10-15 min walk in times square,empire state short walk away. easy access to subway network. continental breakfast included in price,only slight negative point is no where to eat breakfast people just congrigate in reception area,although it does look like the reception area is going to get extended so maybe that will change in time. really good rates aswell for NYC,had a decent sized room with king bed seperate walk in wardrobe and private bathroom with massive shower. would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Oslo13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights, and has nothing but good things to say about the place. Very friendly staff, CLEAN room, great location and good value for money.
