Our room was a little small, but we knew in advance and booked the room based on that knowledge. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Pinklocket1
Reviews.Content: The MAve hotel offers a fantastic location, based on the corner of 27th street and Madison Avenue you are right in the heart of Manhattan with Times Square, The Empire State building and 5th Avenue just a short walk away. The rooms were immaculate. very clean and modern and equipped with a hair dryer, iron and ironing board, huge flat screen tv and an ipod docking station. The staff were so friendly and very accommodating. Although our room was on street level we did not have any problems with outside noise. Overall I would book again at The MAve purely based on the location and level of excellent service we were given whilst staying 9 nights in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise - customer service, cleanliness and a good location in New York!”
Reviews.Author: Nathalieemma
Reviews.Content: I was really delighted by this place. The reception staff were so friendly, even though we arrived late at night. They gave us restaurant advice, maps and sparkly pens! The room was lovely and clean, a reasonable size for NY, funky and had lots of pillows! The only downside was the air-con unit blocking part of the window (but what can you see in NY anyway!). Oh, and the air-con unit was quite loud but once you cooled the room it stayed cold! The bathroom (shower) was great and had a hairdryer. Iron and board were also included. And there was a great coffee machine - again - not always the norm for NY. I'd definitely stay here again - ticked all my boxes and is the best hotel I have stayed in in NY.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden NYC gem”
Reviews.Author: BobSulz
Reviews.Content: The MAVE we found to be a delightful small hotel in a fine area of Manhattan. The staff was very attentive, the price reasonable, and the rooms extremely comfortable. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet basic comforts away from home...to say the least!”
Reviews.Author: Indoorgrrrl
Reviews.Content: Was required to be in NYC for a business trip... From the word "go"...this hotel was a nightmare...almost comical! Felt like I was in a Chevy Chase movie: 1) The room itself is a shoe box...very uncomfortable even by NYC standards. 2) The shower is very strange! No shower curtain or door...so, everything in the bathroom got wet! Then I noticed a drain in the middle of the bathroom floor and realized why after I took a shower...very weird! 3) The room's window did not offer any barrier to the outside traffic noise...kept me up all night! I know it's NYC, but this was absolutely bad. 4) Not even a coffee maker in the room...had to actually call down to the front desk to ask for one, then it did not even work. 5) The room service menu is very limited and very expensive (and automatically adds over 25% tip...outrageous!) 6) All this for a far out $$$ of over 425.00 / night (including taxes and fees)...dreadful deal. There was one plus...the staff at the front desk were nice. They did give me some money off of my bill due to above. But I still will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best EVER bed, service and location...incredible stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: chrisnoland
Reviews.Content: The Mave is exactly what you want for your stay in NYC. My friends and I just went the US Open for 5 days and found a deal on the Mave, which made it even better, but I'd pay full price for the service and amazing bed. Best night sleep I've ever had, and I always stay in Westins for the heavenly bed. Not sure what the bed is but I may call and ask so I can buy one! The service was also unheard of. Everything we asked about, they got for us! Coffee to the room because we woke up late...hot tea for a friend who got sick, recommendations for anything and everything, and just sweet, friendly people. This is a very small hotel so they have time for you and get to know you. And regarding location, you are 1 block to the subway and can easily walk to Chelsey, Union Square, Park and Madison Ave shopping, etc., and it's a $5 cab ride to Soho, Little Italy, etc. We didn't do time square, central park, or the theater district this time, but it's so convenient because it's central and on a great corner. No real negatives, although the room is quite small, but it's all you need. The photos will make it seem a little cooler than it is...room was very plain, but we did have wood blinds on the windows, wood floors and a great tv and shower. Just no where to hang out...but who stays in the room in NYC!?!? Have fun and definitely stay at the Mave!

Reviews.Title: “Really Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Traveller200926
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. We had a terrible journey over and were really late to arrive but the member of staff who greeted us made us feel really welcome. He also recommended a super bar which was perfect for 2 weary travellers. It was my partners birthday and when we got to our room we had cakes and a personalised welcome message which was a lovely touch. Also my special request for a champagne breakfast on his birthday was not a problem. Infact, I felt like I could've asked for anything and the staff would have done their utmost to accommodate us. The room was gorgeous. It looked exactly like the picture and the bed was amazingly comfortable. The location is another bonus. Subway stations are just round the corner and it's a couple of minutes walk from the open top bus tour pick up point which I'd also recommend. The Free Wifi was fast as well. This is a super hotel and I would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to stay somewhere a little bit different but doesn't want to compromise on quality.

Reviews.Title: “So Chic.....Excellent Customer Service...Staff is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TravelinLight199
Reviews.Content: New hotel with small (but expected in NY) rooms. Very clean. Chic modern decor. Good value. The hotel staff is very accommodating, cheerful and helpful. Close to subway, and lots of restaurants. I love it here. I visit NY twice a month - It's my new favorite boutique hotel in New York!

Reviews.Title: “I don't know...”
Reviews.Author: ElisaLeone
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we expected the classical big room. In reality we found a very small room, clean, but small. You can imagine a family of 4 people with 6 luggage. It was difficult for us to move in the room. Even the bathroom was small and the shower was not closed and everytime we had a shower, we soaked everywhere. It is not too expensive, but I think that there are better hotel that this. Also the position was not so good...to move we always needed a taxi. I don't know if I advise this hotel...maybe look for something else...

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Personal Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bren21
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in a Queen Room and loved it, it was stylish with beautiful Bedding and tolietries. It was very clean and fresh with a great shower,and had aircon which was great. The breakfast was lovely, and the pastries to die for. I don't drink coffee but my husband said it was really good, every morning i asked the waiter for tea and was given the hottest cup of tea ever (i loved it) We would definitely return and would recomend to anyone. Keep up the good work.Brenda Arbuckle.Scotland)

Reviews.Title: “Great Crash Pad in Good Location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: sabab172
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two teenage sons at The MAve in June 2010 to celebrate my 40th birthday. The hotel is in a convenient and walkable location to the main hub of NYC. The rooms yes are small but have everything you need and are clean and maintained well. I see from other reviews that it was noisy and yes it was but I have stayed in NYC before and that is part of the experience "The City That Never Sleeps". We were pretty exhausted with the sightseeing and jet lag so we slept through much of the noise anyway. We loved the complimentary pastries and the coffee in the morning as it was booked on a "Room Only" basis. The staff were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The only slight hitch was that we wanted rooms next door/on the same floor as we had out two teenage sons in a twin room. Unfortunately they were two floors down but I do put this down to our booking agent not requesting in time. Overall I would recommend The MAve is you are having a whistle stop tour of the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, very good staff, small room, hyper noisy”
Reviews.Author: Tobers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in a double room which was very small. Nowhere to put an open suitcase, and only possible to exit the bed on one side. As a "crash pad" it was OK, but no more than that. The kids had a twin (which we had to pay quite a bit more for) which was roomier. The staff were great - always helpful and perky which was good after a sleepless night due to the very noisy air conditioner one inch from my head, and street noise which felt like the window was open even though it wasnt. The breakfast buffet was OK if desperate for a coffee, but with nowhere to sit it was a bit of a waste of time. Renovations on the way for the lobby by the look of it. The restaurant list provided by the hotel was spot on - everyone a winner. The hotel location was pretty good too. I'd recommend it with the caveats of size and noise.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, but good rates”
Reviews.Author: katiekins570
Reviews.Content: The MAve is well-located and well-priced--these are its main recommendations. The place has some style, the free wi-fi, flat-screen tv and iPod dock are nice touches, and the staff is friendly and helpful--but in the end, the selling point is a clean room in a prime Manhattan location. We are former New Yorkers coming back for a visit, and we just needed a place to sleep and leave our stuff in an area convenient to everything we wanted to do--and this fit the bill. We had the most basic room category, which has a full bed--not a queen, as another reviewer said--and is about the size of a decent walk-in closet. But that was fine--we knew what we were getting into. The room was very clean, with crisp white bedding and a modern bathroom. A couple downsides: the humidity in the room was never quite right, so the sheets often felt damp, and the blinds let in a lot of light come morning. We got a lot of use out of the free wi-fi and certainly appreciated that amenity. One suggestion I would make is not to have such sharp corners on the beds in such a tight room, which invites people like me to smash open a toe on them. But whatever, I am clumsy. The part that concerned me was when I asked for extra pillows to elevate my foot and a staff member (who had come very quickly with band-aids and antiseptic wipes) told me there were no extra pillows in the entire hotel. Seriously? In a hotel? To be fair, he managed to produce some fairly quickly after that. Despite any such issues, overall it was decent value in the amazingly overpriced world of Manhattan hotels. The location was really the selling point--right in the very central Gramercy area, easy walking distance to Union Square, close to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: camt11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, I can't wait to go back!!! I have traveled a lot and this hotel had some of the best staff I've ever met (at par with many 4-5 star hotels I've stayed at) and the design of the rooms is superb -- right in the heart of NYC. This is a small boutique hotel that was completely renovated within the last year and no expense was spared. I was very surprised to find out that our standard (non-upgraded) room included: - queen bed with pillow top mattress - plasma tv with cable box - free wireless & wired internet (nice perk!) - gorgeous bathroom with designer sink, glass shower & rain shower - very modern design, furniture, art, etc. - free breakfast (coffee + snacks) - 5-10 min walk to park, bars, shopping, subway, restaurants & bars I've stayed in NYC before and paid nearly double the price for hotels that weren't anywhere near as nice as the MAve. Yes the rooms are small, but this is NYC, if you want a larger room you'll need to stay in the suburbs or pay at least 2-3x the price somewhere else. Before staying at this hotel I read the reviews on TripAdvisor and I don't think that people are comparing apples to apples on some of the negative reviews (ie: yes the room was tiny compared to places I've stayed in the suburbs.....but it was also about double the size of a 5 star hotel I stayed in Hong Kong). So here's my view on a few of the negatives that people have mentioned: - Rooms are small. Yes they are, but the hotel posts the size of their rooms on their website so that's up to you to decide. Personally I didn't go to New York to sit in my room, we were out all day shopping and taking in the sites and I can tell you that after an entire day of walking the spacious shower and pillow top beds felt like heaven! - Traffic is noisy. Personally I didn't have a problem sleeping and wasn't woken up by any noise, but I'm guessing that if you haven't been to New York before then adjusting to the noise of traffic might be hard - maybe ask to stay on a higher floor further up from the street? So this isn't really a downside of the hotel, it's just something to get used to about NYC. - Breakfast is bad. It's a continental breakfast which means coffee and baked goods (which were actually really good). If you're looking for a larger meal or something different, there are a few cafe's less than 5 mins away or room service. I did find that the coffee wasn't that great and let management know, a few days later they emailed me saying that they have changed to a new brand of coffee....you can't ask for better response to customer feedback than that. Also, keep in mind that the breakfast is free! - No fridge / restaurant in hotel. This is true, it's a small boutique hotel without a restaurant, but there are several places to eat nearby and room service is available. The rooms don't have a fridge (a bit disappointing) but the hotel staff was able to keep our stuff in the hotel fridge and brought us buckets of ice every day.

Reviews.Title: “We were so pleasantly surprised by how...”
Reviews.Author: Swaban
Reviews.Content: We were so pleasantly surprised by how great our stay was at the Mave for a weekend in late April! The location was fantastic--very conveniently close to everything. When we arrived, the front desk was very helpful in terms of making restaurant suggestions and helping us plan our days. The room was relatively large, with high ceilings, a fabulous sleek modern bathroom and a large comfy bed with lots of pillows--divine! They even offer a nice continental breakfast with a good selection of pastries and nice strong coffee. We were so thrilled to discover this gem--a personal boutique hotel with helpful staff and ideal location! It's become now our place to stay when we visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: hereishome
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room at the Palace Hotel for four nights and at the last minute I read about this place in the NY Times travel section--when I did the math, I realized this would be half the price of the Palace and in a location that was more preferable to me given our plans, so I changed the res to the MAve. The staff was very welcoming and we received a map and a list of nearby restaurants upon check-in. Our room was terrific for the price--clean, king size bed, small desk area, plenty of drawers to put our clothes and a closet area (not to mention the extra space of the missing fridge where we housed our luggage)! The bathroom was sufficient in terms of size and amenities such as H2O bath products, hair dryer--we had to ask for extra towels because for some reason the entire bathroom got soaked when we took a shower--the hotel accommodated that need. If you have trouble sleeping with noise, this may not be the place for you. They were working outside and at one point it sounded like they drilling was being done in our room. We didn't mind because it was time to be out enjoying our day anyway. The staff answered any questions and printed up info for us each time we left the hotel. There was one woman working at the desk who seemed to always be on the phone when we came and went--it was obvious they were personal calls--but she did give us good information. Everyone else was 100% present and attentive. The location was terrific--very close to the subway and Madison Square Park--and easiest locale I ever stayed in to hail a cab! There's a Halal truck that lives right across the street and a 24 hour salon one block down (where we got 2am pedicures). We would definitely stay here again--had some very nice meals and did some great shopping with the money we saved because of choosing this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Super great staff”
Reviews.Author: superjill2010
Reviews.Content: Very clean and modern looking. Last minute business trip and the staff was so helpful with planning site seeing and mapping my paths. Small room, but perfect for business travel. Stored my luggage safely all day and let me in drop off more stuff to add. Extremely reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Decent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunnyeveryday
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights. Their staff are friendly in general although we were very frustrated with them the first two days because they wouldn't honor their Travelzoo discount offer. They did fix it at the end but it was still annoying having to worry about it the first few days of our trip. That's why they get 3 stars instead of 4 stars on service. The location is very good especially for the price - the 6 train station is only a few minutes away. The room is not big even though we have the king size bed room - compare to Embassy Suite , Affinia, and Millenium we stayed before. But I heard the 3 hotels I stayed at are the exceptions in NYC. Most hotel rooms in NYC are supposedly tiny. One of their 2 elevators was out of order the whole time but we didn't care since we stayed on the 3rd floor. We ended up walking up the stairs most of the time. Overall, the experience was ok. If small boutique hotel is your thing, this is not a bad choice. Just make sure you confirm your hotel price in writing especially if you got a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking for something else”
Reviews.Author: A_Gabor
Reviews.Content: I recently went to New York with my spouse and another couple. We generally stay at 4 or 5 star hotels when visiting, but due to our friends' budget we looked into something a bit more affordable. The MAve was one of the better options as it was well located and appeared really nice in the pictures. The pictures are really misleading. The rooms are tiny, as in so small you can barely fit two suitcases and still have room to walk around. The shower was okay, though the entire bathroom was very small. The doors don't close well unless you really push/pull hard. If you do stay here, always double check that it's actually closed. The entire hotel is very basic. There is a safe which works only half the time (we had to enter our code between 3 and 5 times before it would respond). There is no mini bar, if you want water you can go down to the lobby and ask for a bottle of room temperature water. The AC consist of a noisy AC unit in the window of each room. There is a breakfast table where pastries and coffee can be found in the morning, but there is no restaurant in the hotel. The elevators are tiny. After checking out, we left our luggage at the hotel and went shopping. Upon our return, we wanted to use the washroom, but there is no washroom in the lobby, they sent us to a neighboring hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Only if I had no where else to stay and was on a strict budget”
Reviews.Author: GinDandy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has no lobby, no bar to atmosphere. I like to walk in to a hotel and get a sense of the place and the Mave had no personality. The staff was very nice, place seemed old even though it is relatively new. The rooms were a decent size, but sparse and utilitarian. Probably a good place to stay if I were a college student on a budget, or not looking to spend any time in the hotel or my room.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: louiseg28
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at The Mave, we were upgraded free as it was our anniversary. The room was very nice with everything that we needed. Every member of staff were very polite and helpful. The location of the Mave was great. Breakfast was a good choice of pastries and coffee to get you started in the morning. Both lifts were in working order during our stay and unlike others who have said it was a noisy place, you are in New York (the city that never sleeps) and we found it to be not as bad as we were expecting. We were able to leave our cases safely on departure day while we shopped and collected them later. All in all we had an excellent stay at the Mave and would definately stay there again. Thanks to all at the Mave for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not that perfect”
Reviews.Author: Republic0
Reviews.Content: I booked after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, maybe I expected too much. Location is very good, although we did not find the kind of shop we wanted in the close neighbourhood, something where we could buy some water or some food.Reception was fine. although first we were told we could get an upgrade which we didn't get in the end. Elevator extremely slow, only one was in working condition throughout our stay. The room was tiny, even considering that this is Manhattan, not at all suitable for 2 people, there was no room at all for the suitcases for example. If you wanted to sit by the desk, the other person couldn't enter the bathroom. There was shower gel, soap, etc. for one person only. although we really liked that brand. We wanted to use the safe in the room but it didn't work. We were supposed to have a minibar, there was none. TV was ok, lots of channels, nice picture, the bed was very comfortable. Our room was very noisy, lots of street noise all night long and also early in the morning.Complimentary breakfast is complementary (you do not pay separately for it, but you pay a huge sum for the room), but I wouldn't dare call it breakfast. Some pastries(not always fresh!) and coffee. But you cannot sit anywhere to eat it. There are small paper plates, but no tray to take it up to your room. Some moms tried to take something upstairs for their children but it's just impossible. No juice, nothing to drink, just coffee. They only have wifi, so if you don't take a laptop with you (why would you do that when you go on vacation?) you cannot have access to the internet. Internet access could be found at some eateries at very high prices. Staff could have told us we could get that free at public libraries. Checkout was ok, but when I asked the receptionist to call us a cab, she went out in the street to hail one which really surpised us. We could do that ourselves too. Overall, not a bad experience, but next time we will choose a cheaper hotel, we only spent the nights there after all.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: toddjg
Reviews.Content: Booked into the MaVe for two nights. Excellant service, the staff went out of their way to be helpful and gave advice on local sights/restaurants etc.. The room was stylish and fitted out with LCD tv and ipod doc although I was out most of the time so had no need to us them. Only criticism of the room would be that it was not particularly large but I don't think many NY hotel rooms are and this is probably nit picking. The breakfast was coffee and pastries of which there were plenty and thay were fresh both mornings I was there. As regards sightseeing the location of the hotel is ideal. I walked to it from Penn Station with a large roller case in approx 15 mins. Its not that strenuous and its all on the flat. The empire state building is a short walk away and the Flatiron building is very close. I had a great stay here and after searching for ages I think as other reviews have suggested this hotel compared to others locally will exceed your expectations of a reasonable city boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: MGorgoner
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Location is perfect, the staff was very helpful and friendly, and the rooms are nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectations!”
Reviews.Author: MsMarbo
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I had a wonderful 3 night stay at the Mave, with the friendliness and helpfulness of the front desk service the most notable feature. The rooms are small but tastefully appointed and comfortable and come equipped with free wi-fi. The location is fantastic for a quick stroll down to Union Square or up to Midtown with lots of great restaurants and shops in the vicinity. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely visit!”
Reviews.Author: irana5kat50
Reviews.Content: Having thouroughly read and then re-read all of the Trip Advisor reviews I have to say I am in agreement with all of those who rated The Mave Hotel as excellent. The staff was polite and friendly but not intrusive. They gave us a lot of help which we appreciated very much especially since we felt very intimidated by New York upon arrival. We stayed 4 nights and felt like seasoned New Yorkers by the time we left. The bed was comfortable, our room was more spacious than I had expected. I enjoyed the grab and go breakfast. We prefer boutique type hotels when we travel and we were very happy at The Mave. The location is perfect as we took morning walks to Union Square to buy fresh apples each morning it was open, strolled through and around Madison Square Park and Grammercy Park before we set out to tour the city. We felt safe any time of day and Taxi service was readily available. It was just perfect for us and met my expectations. We slept well, there was some minor street noise but it wasn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond a little gem...”
Reviews.Author: shelleyfLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: it is true - sometimes it just happens - you book a hotel in NY with a good rate and you expectations are not high and then your taxi pulls up to The Mave and you are immediately enveloped into the world of what hoteling should be....speedy and couteous check-in, wonderful accomodating front desk staff and baggage assistance, clean, bright and well appointed room - comfy bed - great amentites all situated in the Flat Iron district of the City....great shops, parks eats and easy transportation...sometimes it just happens and believe me it is happening at The Mave

Reviews.Title: “Sleek style, comfy room, (shockingly) friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: upst8NYgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night when we were down in the city for St. Patrick's Day. This hotel and its staff are much, much nicer than they have to be given the location and the price. We stayed in a king-bed room, which was roomy. I suspect some of the other rooms sizes might have felt cramped, but if you're looking for a boutique hotel in NYC, you probably know the drill. Both the out-of-the-way closet area and large console with doors where you could store luggage went a long way towards making the room feel bigger and not cluttered. The room was very nicely appointed: high-quality linens/pillows, iPod dock and flat-screen TV. Tastefully decorated: upholstered headboard, minimalist (but adequate) window treatments and nice art on the wall. It was the antithesis of a cookie-cutter corporate room, which is just what I was looking for. As for location, they're just over a block from the subway, so no quibbles there. They're on the corner, so easy for cabbies to find (and unload your bags if you're an over-packer like me!) I've stayed in boutique hotels before, mostly in Miami, so I'm sort of used/resigned to boutique hotel attitude.. you know, "I'm only checking you in because the right person hasn't seen my head shot yet" type of service. I was expecting that here when we came in because the lobby is very bright/funky/edgy: typical boutique look. *Not* the case at all. Everyone I spoke to when we checked in and later called down for info (can't remember about what, sorry) was courteous and professional. I didn't check out either their room service (although the menu looked nice) or the fitness center (lazy!) but I am planning to book at this hotel again, so if I do use either of those two I'll post an update.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindsaymarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MAve for our honeymoon in October of last year. The staff we among the politest I've ever come across, and upgraded our room when we mentioned our honeymoon. They gave us lots of info about NYC as well. It was a good base, and if you don't mind doing some walking you can see a lot. The rooms are not large, but we weren't spending much time in our hotel room. They were very clean, as was the bathroom. You can hear noise from the street, but we didn't find that to be a big deal. We took advantage of the free coffee and pastries in the morning, but usually went out for breakfast at a little coffee shop around the corner. I enojyed our stay, and would definately recommend it to someone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Hotel at a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: worldxplorer12
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about this place. I stayed with my life for a weekend trip to NYC and was so pleased with the value received. The decor is modern and clean, the bathrooms are great and the beds are so comfortable. Staff can't be beat as far as service and the location is superb -- centrally located and in walking distance of all the sites we wanted to hit. Despite staying for a leisure trip this time, I will definitely be staying here for business trips going forward as it's a block from the 6 train making it easy to get uptown or down. Well done. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Modern Oasis”
Reviews.Author: in2xtc
Reviews.Content: I booked the MAve for a great rate on Travelzoo. This location was perfect for us; within a short walk of Union Square, Greenwich Village and Lower East Side shops and restaurants. We stayed in a Madison King room and were very pleased with the size of the room, the decor and amenities. The only complaint was that the shower had a 1/2 glass enclosure and the water invariably got all over the bathroom floor. The city noise was very loud from our room but didn't keep us from sleeping, just added to the ambiance. The staff was awesome, super friendly and helpful. We saw the same people in the morning and evening so always recognized and greeted. All in all, a great stay and would definitely return to the MAve!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing - but small.”
Reviews.Author: Groovysheep
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here although it was purely a base. The hotel is situated at the bottom end of mid-town so quite a walk to time square, which I didn't mind as you get to see so much. The hotel lobby is small and neat but has no where to sit. The staff were always very friendly and polite. My room was small for a double, thank god I was on my own, but it was modern and tidy. My window over looked a brick wall and did nothing to keep the noise out, the only thing that did that was the air conditioner which was conveniently situated by the head board. The bed was very comfy. The bathroom was a fine size and modern, but the shower would leak a little depending where you stand. All together this was a nice hotel but for the same or lesser price I would prefere something more central personally.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in the Heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: davey10j
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from 5 nights at the MAve & had a fantastic stay. the room (Queen) was large enough for 2 adults and larger than other NY hotel rooms i've stayed in. The decor was clean, the bed was fantastic the bathroom was large enough & was well equipped (shower gels etc...) The staff were great & welcoming, the location is absolutely ideal for most Manhatten locations & it is surrounded by loads of great restaurants & bars. The was a little street noise (we were on the 9th floor) but to be honest if you don't like that then don't go to New York - I've stayed in rooms on higher floors in oteh hotels & it's just the same. I would definately stay here again - the only down side is that there was nowhere to sit whilst we were waiting for our airport transfer. The reception staff gave us sme fold out chairs but we felt a bit daft sittin on them in the middle of the lobby. I'm sure however that this will be looked into in time. Overall this is a real gem of a hotel - loved every minute of it!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Yet Unpretentious”
Reviews.Author: DivaVienna
Reviews.Content: I felt very safe and well taken care of at the MAve. Things I liked: free internet, big safe (laptop fit) free continental breakfast, didn't feel nickeled and dimed, clean, good sheets wood floors (no disgusting carpets) I-Pod / MP3 docking station. Staff was friendly and professional Stored shopping bags for me that I dropped off, so that I didn't need to go up to my room. The building itsself is not an architectural gem, but the heart put into renovating it more than makes up for this. Price was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Funky boutique hotel - spot on for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Chanty
Reviews.Content: On reading reviews of the MAve I was concerned about making a booking as I had read about the tiny rooms, lifts that dont work etc etc and its always the negatives that stick in your mind but Im really glad I went ahead and stayed here. Excellent location - close to 2 subways. Staff couldnt be more helpful and friendly and polite, excellent recommendations of places to eat etc. The rooms were compact but excellently furnished and clean as a whistle. The price was also good for NYC which is rediculously expensive. Yes the breakfast was small - they had pastries and coffee on a table in the reception, but I always think its nice to go out for breakfast on a short break anyway and make the most of your time in another city. It was loud at night too I have to admit but we were slap bang in the middle of new York so I was kind of expecting the sounds of sirens every now and then anyway! All in all, absolutely perfect for a short city break where you use your hotel as a place to rest your head and the important things are location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “More than Awesome”
Reviews.Author: EMTGolfPro
Reviews.Content: Having waited til the last minute to book a room for the on the town, I was more pleased with the Mave. Yes the rooms are somewhat small but I was not goinf to live there just visiting. And yes the elevator was small but I was only using it to go to my room not using it to travel on vacation. Overall it was an inexpensive, enjoyable experience and as I write this I am booking a room for tonight 2/6/2010. You would be foolish not to try The Mave. And lastly you are in an area of the city where you can want for nothing because everything you need is there. 5stars for the Mave

Reviews.Title: “A piece of my heart, at the heart of the world!”
Reviews.Author: capotruz
Reviews.Content: The MAve is a good choice if you want a value for money solution. The bad: the rooms are a bit tiny and - perhaps - noisy. I don't like the heater, maybe just because I am european. I would suggest to ask for an upper floor accomodation. If you can, reserve a superior room The good: the Staff is incredibly kind and helpful. I have to add that they are all really beautiful looking! The hotel is located in an ideal position, 10-15 minutes away from any destination in Manhattan (just walk and/or buy the 7-days metro card), but must mention that the Flatiron district is very quite at night and charming too. Rooms are clean and overall OK for NYC. Just have a look at BAD points if you want to know what is out of perfection... You can have a fast breakfast, but if you prefer, there is a Starbucks next block. Finally, I do reccomend a stay at the MAve!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with excellent staff....diamond find”
Reviews.Author: henrylondonuk
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the MAve this weekend, we were pleasantly surprised with the great contemporary decor, rooms were cute and really clean. everything was impeccable, bedding, shower etc....however the best part of our stay was definately the staff...they really looked after us and went that extra mile. For example, I had forgotton my phone charger and rang up reception who said that they ha some and would send one up. I received a phonecall within 5 minutes to be told htat the hotel had 6 international chargers, however all of them were being used by other guests. Michael (reception staff) offered that they could go and purchase one for me if i needed. Within 15 minutes they had sent somebody to go purchase one and bring it up to me. I enquired how much I owed them, to my surprise I was told that as a guest staying i could use the charger till my check out and it would not cost me anything!!! Overall, staff went out of their way to help us - overall a lovely hotel, prime location, contemporary decor, delicious complimentary pastries and croissant breakfast, with great service. Definately would go back there and reccommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: shytai287
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. My friends and I had 2 rooms (1 room with Queen bed and another room with 2 double beds). We were expecting the rooms to be really small since it's a boutique hotel, but they were pleasantly spacious. Bathrooms were very clean and modern. Big showerheads! The hotel is located in a very safe, active neighborhood. So it's very easy to catch a cab or walk a few blocks to a ton of restaurants and shops. The best thing about this hotel is the customer service. All the staff are super friendly and eager to help make your stay better by answering any questions and/or making suggestions. My friends and I would DEFINITELY stay at the Mave again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: livelifetobehappy
Reviews.Content: When I first started planning for our first trip to NYC, I was a little apprehensive on how we're going to get around, and whether we're in the right location. To our pleasant surprise, The MAve Hotel was very centrally located, around the corner from the Subway station, and walkable to many sights (Union Square, Flatiron Building, among others). The staff was friendly, helpful, and go above and beyond to fulfill our every need. Cruz helped us with figuring out how to get from JFK to the hotel, and emailed me directions before our trip when I called to ask for advice. Jenn helped us with restaurant options around the area and the city. We were looking for vegetarian restaurants, so she found some that were high ranked, and emailed the suggestions to us. The staff was more than happy to work with us when we decided to stay an extra night because we loved NYC so much! We were able to check in early after a red eye flight, checked out a little late, and the staff was happy to hold our luggage until we were ready to head for the airport. There is a charge for valet, but it was still cheaper than all the parking around the area. Make sure you don't have a car when you visit, you don't need it, and parking is a hassle. The hotel staff have amazing service! I was very impressed with the personal attention by the staff to help make our first trip a memorable experience. The room was spacious for NYC standards, a little noisy, but I was not bothered by it since it was the music of the city. Housekeeping was courteous and helpful. The only thing is, there is no shower curtain, so make sure you bring a pair of sandals to walk around in. Overall, I can't recommend this hotel enough. I have traveled the world and stayed in many hotels, I was VERY impressed with how comfortable and pleasant we felt about our stay at the MAve. Ask for Cruz when you plan for your trip, and you'll have an amazing experience as well!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel- great value, great service and wonderful rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Rhone11
Reviews.Content: Having visited NYC on several occasions in the past, we were both delighted with the expereince in the MAve hotel. Small, new, modern and incredibly friendly from the moment we arrived on New Years Eve the staff were helpful, check in quick AND the room we had (Boulevard King..) certainly did not disappoint. Modern, much bigger than our usual NYC expereince, all mod cons, and great modern bathroom. The bed was quite simply divine, and the service we experienced on arrival did not diminsh once in the 7 day stay. We alwasy got help with information/ reservations/ advice from the warm, courteous and engaged staff. They made a real difference and were always ready with some advice/ help when we needed it. Complimentary coffee and pastries were made available first thing in the morning- which really got us moving. The location of the hotel was great for us, just 2 blocks from the Flatiron Building, which meant we could easily access subways and taxis for journyes up and down town. Really convenient, and there was a coffee shop for breakfast 2 doors away and a deli one block up. All in all, we definitely recommend the MAve, great value and made our chill out time in the Big Apple incredibly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel this most certainly is not...”
Reviews.Author: RBB1982
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at the MAve through Expedia. The rate appeared to be good. The hotel was listed as a new boutique hotel in the Flatiron district of NYC. We opted for a "Urban Double" which included continental breakfast and taxes. So far, so good. Upon arrival, our reservation was not listed (apparently an issue with the way Expedia place bookings with the hotel). Not an issue as there was a room available - however this is a little concerning during a busy period! We were advised by a very friendly member of staff at the check in desk that breakfast would be served in the back lobby between 7 and 9am daily. The lobby had been bright and modern so I was a little surprised by the old lift in the lobby which was not in keeping with the theme (whatever that theme was!). The room was located on the 7th floor at the front of the building. So we were facing Madison Avenue. Not ideal as this is a very busy road. First problem is the size of the room...I am aware that space is of a premium in NYC and frequently the room sizes are small - however this basically only just fitted the double bed and drawer unit. Most of the window was taken up by an air con/ heater unit which was not only obscuring the view of the busy road but also amplifying the noise coming from said road - quite considerably. The temperature felt arctic in there so we turned the heater on - and - as expected this was noisy enough to compete with the road noise. So, we put our bags down...On the bed as there was no floor space for them both without obstructing both the bathroom and main room doors. There is a small area to hang your clothes - an ironing board (but iron available only from service desk- useful), a luggage rack which you couldn't open as there was not enough room for it, an en suite bathroom which was clean and satsfactory, but again, certainly not up to the "Boutique" hotel standard I was expecting - more travel lodge. The bed was very comfortable which was a great plus. The TV which although I don't spend very much time watching - was on the wall adjacent to the bed which in such a narrow room gave you terrible neck ache just to look at even only for the news! The main light is incredibly bright and against the white walls was harsh for tired eyes - they have no small lamp in this size room... So - sleeping was comfortable and clean but not in any way "Boutique", "A Sanctuary" or "Relaxing" as promised by the hotel. Down to the "Continental breakfast" which was included in our rate. On the way down in the lift we noticed people taking food back to rooms which we thought was a little strange, until we actually got down to the lobby and realised that quite literally in the back of the lobby is a table with a paper cloth on and some paper plates with a selection of mini pastries, flasks of coffee, milk, paper cups, paper plates, paper napkins. If I had booked a stay at a motel or budget hotel - I would be perfectly satisfied with this. However, for our romantic mini break in a "Boutique" hotel - this is not what I expected. Did I actually have to pay for this as part of my rate? I really hope not...We took our cold coffee and mini croissant, out on to the steps of a lobby across the street. This was not as I had pictured before we came! In summary - this hotel would be the perfect budget option for young travellers looking for a central location. Unfortunately, neither the price tag or the website describe it as such. This place could have been a gem. It is in a great location in the cool Flatiron district. Not far from the Empire State Building or from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and the garment district, and a short walk to Soho/ Nolita areas. If only it didn't promise what it clearly doesn't deliver! This hotel is over priced and over ambitious. If you get a cheap rate and expect nothing more than a Premier Inn or Travel Lodge - then this place is for you. If you are looking for a boutuque hotel for your romantic mini break - go to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New York is an amazing place and this is an amazing place to stay while there!!!”
Reviews.Author: Misslje
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MAve hotel over New Year and had an amazing time. My boyfriend booked the holiday as a suprise Birthday present for me so i had not seen the Hotel untill we arrived but i have to say he did very well and picked a fantasitc place to stay. We satyed in a queen suite on the 5th floor which had a good view of Maddison Avenue. Our room was quite small but had everything we needed and was extremley clean and tidy. The bed was so comfortable and the room was modern with a lovely shower room. The wardrobe space was a little limited but apart from that it was perfect. It had everything you will need such as hair dryer, iron, ipod dock, flat screen tv, desk etc... There was dry cleaning & room service avalible but we did not need to use either during our stay. The Hotel provide a compilmentary grab and go breakfast which had a nice choice of fresh pasteries everyday. The staff at the Hotel were among the most helpful i have ever come across while on Holiday. They really couldnt do enough for you and went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure we had a fantastic stay. Annetta in particular was so helpful to us while on our stay. The staff told us of loads of great places to go eat, booked a helicoptor tour for us and even helped us out when we had trouble with our Airport transfers once we had checked out of the hotel. (The company we used for Transfers was Super Shuttle- I would reccommed that you dont use this company as we had alot of trouble with them!) The Hotel is situated in the Flatiron area of New York which is really close to the Empire State building.There is no bar in the Hotel its self but there are loads of nice places to eat and drink near by. Its a 15min walk to Times Square, and is really close to Masy's department store! The location for us was perfect. On a whole i cannot reccomend this hotel enough. The room was lovely and the staff so friendly and helpful. New York is an amazing place and this is an amazing place to stay while there.

Reviews.Title: “diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: donakarin
Reviews.Content: there are many hotels around this area but they are either too small,dingy or look like they were made for grandpa bob. The Mave hotel is a superior, modern, and the best deal you could get for the economical price. I went with my fiance and we had a blast. It felt like we were at a 5 star hotel. The beds were luxuriously comfortable, room was very clean, spacy for a NY hotel, 32-inch flat screen t.v. with cable, IHome, personal desk, and breakfast included. Breakfast is only from 7-9 but the concierge offered to bring us up some of that breakfast to our room so we didn't have to go all the way downstairs. And we didn't even have to ask them to bring it up the next day as well, they just automatically brought it up. Also, my birthday was during one of the nights we stayed there and they brought me up cupcakes with a little happy birthday card. Now, thats detailed service. Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ShellharbourLiz09
Reviews.Content: Pricey hotel in a nice district. Did not have too many problems with noise, managed to get to sleep, although it is certainly much noisier in NY than it is at home!! We expected that though, and the noise wasn't a problem, besides the odd horn honking. Rooms were tiny, but also we expected that in NY. Could have stayed cheaper elsewhere but this hotel offered a free breakfast and had good reviews. Free breakfast was a few pastries on a plate and coffee, if you were early enough or they were all gone. A few times there wasn't even any milk for the coffee and we had to wait while reception went down to the shop to buy more. I don't drink coffee so we ended up having to buy breakfast everyday anyway. I asked reception where I could buy stamps to send postcards and he offered to put stamps on and send them for me. This was over 4 weeks ago, I have been home for 3 weeks and still there are no signs of the postcards. There 5 in total, and I'm quite annoyed that I could have just done this myself. Especially as it cost me around US$15 for the postcards and 30 minutes writing them! Reception were very polite and bell boys were very friendly. Glad they had umbrellas for guest use as it poured the first day we arrived, and then snowed! Shower is a major OHS issue. There is only half a pane of glass covering the shower and no door so the entire bathroom floor gets covered in water, making it very slippery, and then the floor towels are soaking wet and there is nowhere to hang them so they can dry out. It won't be long before someone slips in these bathrooms and gets injured.... Would probably not stay in this hotel again unless I got a good deal. Have found cheaper hotels in better locations and whilst the staff were very polite and helpful (except for the postcard incident) , I don't think the amount we spent was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sgarrity
Reviews.Content: Will definately rpeat our stay at the Mave!The staff was more than helpful, the rooms were exceptionally clean, and the location was great! Quiet part of town close to times square and the village. Everything is just a cab ride away($15 or less). A cab from LA is about $40 as well, including tip. I have been to the big three before (Chicago, Boston, nad NYC) although Boston is my favorite city, I will definately return to NYC and The Mave!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy botique hotel, in the heart of Midtown's sights, restaurants, and bars.”
Reviews.Author: Solveig001
Reviews.Content: Forget your chain hotels in Time Square and experience Manhattan like a real New Yorker. The Mave simply gives the feeling of what you'd expect New York to be: trendy, elegant, world class service, and fast-paced. The rooms are quaint, but cozy and fashionable - very much European or cosmopolitan in style. The Mave's location was perfect to walk to nearby sites like the Flatiron building & Empire State building. Also, close to the 4-5-6 green subway line, making it perfect to zip any where in Manhattan in a breeze. Finally, a number of great neighborhood bars and restaurants all within walking distance. As a first time visitor to New York, The Mave made me feel completely at ease and I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “MAve surprised me!”
Reviews.Author: cristinegelato
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at MAve at a rush when we knew that we had to stay one more night before moving into a new apartment in upper east side. The last minute prices were so expensive especially it was right after the Christmas and prices of most hotels we stayed previously had gone up 50%! The MAve attracted us first with its great location near Madison avenue and it is not far away from our previous hotel Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers at 7th ave. As our taxi stopped in front of MAve, someone opened the door and helped with our luggage in the trunk. I was surprised when I saw the front desk lady even came out to help. This was definitely the first time of all my hotel experiences. We felt so welcomed. Also on the same day we came back someone at the front desk came out and opened the door asking if we needed any help with the luggage- this time we didn't carry any luggage so we were fine. He said sorry and closed the door while we were still paying the taxi fees inside the car. It was not rude and once again we felt so welcomed. The service really amazed me!! I don't want to talk much about the room. It was not spacious but as I said the guest services at MAve was superb...that's all I care. I travel a lot every year and my taste of hotel becomes very picky. In the last three months, I stayed at Crown Plaza Time Square, a few Marriot, Disneyland Resort, Bentley, Sheraton, etc . Room size is not what I'm looking for because you spend most of your time sightseeing in the city all you need is a comfortable bed to sleep in. Think about in such a busy area in New York City, every square of space is expensive and you don't expect your room to be that spacious. The noises - hotels in a good location all have problems with noises. What I don't like about hotels in Time Square is the noises and lights coming into the room in the morning when you want a longer sleep. MAve seems it has no problem with the lights - our bed does not face a window =) When you arrive here, front desk staff help you with your luggage to your room and introduce you the amenities in the room. We find it odd at the beginning because no one in other hotels has ever done this. But it shows that people at the MAve do care about their guests. They also recommend good restaurants around the area. We went to one of them for lunch and it turns out that the sandwhich and salad were the best I had ever had! Oh what I love is shampoo/hair wash/lotion they provide here is H2O. In other hotels especially big chain hotels they usually don't provide products from a brand. I absolutely love the smell of the collection. There are definitely space to improve such as: add coffee maker/snacks and fridge to the rooms. I don't like to be thirsty at night especially the heating dries my throat. After all, thanks to the hotel staff provided us with some amazing services which really surprised me. It is unbelievable its such a young hotel that has the superb standard of guest services better than those of many big chain hotels! I am going to recommend the MAve to my friend who is coming to New York in a week.

Reviews.Title: “TINY ROOMS- PICK BEDS WISELY”
Reviews.Author: kfarrowpa
Reviews.Content: Hello, I am here to comment about 8u7my recent stay in NYC for Christmas. The Mave is located close to The Empire State Building and a good walk to Times Square, and Bryant Square. To me, I was most shocked when I walked into our room. It was just a friend and I and the room is smaller than my freshman dormroom (for comparison purposes). If you have more than 2 people, in a room with a full sized bed, you literally will not fit. Also if your significant other is taller or larger built, do not pick a room with a full bed. Not sure why my friend picked this, yes you arent in the room long, but still, it was very very tiny. my advice would be to get the king bed or two double beds for a comfortable stay. Now on the flip side, if you are trying to get a bit closer to that certain someone, then get the full bed :) also the bathrooms are a bit tiny but they are cleaned up each day before you arrive back home. we had some issues with the hot water, it took a bit to warm up but we always had some The hotels guest services were fabulous, i never believe it when people say that, but they will call restaurants and make reservations for you, get your taxis, and recommend some great breakfast and dinner spots. Michael at the front, was a tremendous asset. He suggested the best places he could and we went and they all turned out to be fine dining with some local new yorkers. The only main suggestion would be to pick the size of the beds really well and you should have a great stay here

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, superb staff!”
Reviews.Author: BleckGoteborg
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights Thanksgiving week. We had two rooms, Urban single and double (with two beds). The size of the rooms a small, as usually in NYC for this price, but ok. Some trouble to store our quite big suitcases. Bathrooms are ok. The Mave is newly renovated and went under the name Hotel Madison befor the renovation. It doesent have a bar or even a sitting area in the small lobby. Bars you can find around the corner (Oleana, very cozy) but it had been nice with some sofa or so in the lobby. Its kind of strange but a part of the lobby was for lease. Cant understand why really. Anyway, some reviewers has complanits of the noice level. Not us, but we were att level 9 and 12. But we could hear the elevator when that anounset itself. The continental breakfast is coffe and danish, but there is a good 24/7 open cafe on the same block that has everything you need in food and drink. The best with the Mave is their staff. Wery helpful. I started to mail them like 4 weeks in advance for help with booking tickets and so on. I had answer the next morning, as we live in europe. They had all kind of tips of resturants and other things and always a smile on the faces. They seemed genuinly interested that our stay in NYC should be memorable. Benny Johanson, Sweden

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nes
Reviews.Content: as I have read other people review on Tripadvisor I was litlle scared about the MAve, but my doubts gone as I was entered to our room. Last time when we visited NYC we stayed at fancy and 3 time more expensive Jumeirah Essex house, and the room was smaller in Essex house than in the MAve. Room in the MAVe was extremly clean, spacious, well appointed, with big LCD, good linen, and a lot of places for all of 4 suitcases and a dozen of shopping bags. Bathroom is new and clean with good amnities. Breakfast is to go, some pastries and coffee. People write about the noice. I ahve not got any problem about the noice, I slept like a baby, and after all , this is a New York and not the quiet resort on Maldives. Staff is very very polite, helpful, friendly. They made reservations for us, gave us some recomendations. Just perfect hotel with great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great property - spectacular staff, new rooms, great location in the Flatiron...as good as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: ent_traveler
Reviews.Content: The MAve is a new boutique property in an easily accessible location on Madison Ave just south of Mid-town, in the Flatiron district. It's 2 blocks in either direction from different subway lines, and in a nice neighborhood with a 24 hr. drugstore around the corner and Madison Sq. Park nearby. The rooms are new, with extremely comfortable beds, great baths, flatscreen HDTV, free wi-fi, and good workspace. 90% of NY hotel rooms are closet-sized, and the MAve is much better than most - their Boulevard/Madison rooms are spacious, great for 2 people, and priced right. Complimentary continental breakfast is a nice perk. It's nice to have as you walk out the door, or you can grab it and run back to your room...they tell you on check-in it's 'grab and go.' The one thing that really stood out with The MAve was the staff. By far some of the best hotel staff I've run across in NYC. Friendly, accommodating, and no attitude or pretentiousness in sight. Very willing to give as much help as they could, in every instance. RE: the noise complaints - there was some noise bleed from the street, but with the heat running at night, I wasn't bothered at all. Not something I'd be all that concerned about - in NYC, there's no such thing as perfect quiet, and you get used to it very quickly. There was a solid, insulated block on both sides of the window a/c unit, and that helps a lot with noise reduction. Regardless, in my experience, if you do have issues with noise...or anything else...the staff here will do anything possible to make sure guests have a good night's sleep and a good stay in the city. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel with modern style”
Reviews.Author: hotelguest132
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in the midtown area of Manhattan. Within walking distance to two subway stops. Madison park and Union square are also within a few blocks distance. The rooms are not huge but have more than enough space. The decor is modern and the staff is extremely diligent in helping with any request. I would definitely recommend this hotel for any type of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TW_Dublin
Reviews.Content: I've just spent five nights at the Mave. The rooms are noisy, as other reviewers have noted. But then â€“ welcome to New York! Still, this place is worth recommending on the basis of the location, which is fantastic (equidistant from uptown and downtown, and within walking distance of many attractions and good restaurants), the friendliness of the staff, and also on the cleanliness of the rooms. They are, it must be said, tiny, but again, that's New York for you. Space is at a premium. One issue: in the laughably-titled penthouse there are no bedside lamps for reading at night. This is ludicrous. (It implies that the guests can't read.) But that's a relatively small quibble. In short, this is a super-convenient, funky, clean, relatively inexpensive new hotel. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: OzTink
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NY and we spent the first 5 nights at the MAve (on their stay for 5, pay for 4 promotion). I had read the reviews here on TA before booking, but it was a very new hotel then and had just opened with only a few reviews. I was a little concerned as I read of the noise problem and it is a problem, however I have since read they are installing buffers around the airconditioners. It does sound like the window is WIDE open, even though it is closed. However, I can say, you get used to it if you stay long enough! The first night (and after a 21 hour flight) it was extremely loud, traffic, tooting, sirens, garbage trucks and street sweepers - I could not sleep from the noise or jet-lag! We were on the 6th floor. However, we did not complain and actually got used to the noise after the 2nd night. Nights 3-5 we slept soundly (from exhaustion from the hectic days). However I will still give this hotel 5*s purely for effort from their staff. Everyone we spoke with helped us happily and always asked if there was more they could do. The guys on at night would recommend dinners, night spots, places to make sure we should see (Halloween parade). There was also a bottle of champagne in our room on arrival for our anniversary. The rooms are extremely clean and an adequate size. We hardly spent any time in them so we didn't need extra space. Great location in the middle of 2 subway lines so we could get whereever we needed to go easily. And lastly the breakfast on the go was great! Would get ourselves some fresh coffee and a few danishes and dash out the door for another day of exploring such a fabulous city. We also stayed at another hotel for the last 2 nights and preferred this one of the 2.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at MAve Hotel if you want a good night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: nancys941
Reviews.Content: We stayed at MAve for 3 nights & it was like we were right on the street with all the trucks, cars, sirens & traffic. We were given air plugs & tried to sleep with television on & AC unit turned up to drown out noise, but it was still really bad. When I complained, the desk clerk said "You should live where I do, if you think this is noisy". Not a very good thing to say to a paying guest. We paid a significant amount for our room which I thought we could have done a lot better for the price we paid. It was a lot of money for 3 sleepless nights.

Reviews.Title: “Mave is the Rave!”
Reviews.Author: NG13mia
Reviews.Content: I knew I was in for something different when the Taxi was dropping me off at the hotel and you can see the vibrant colors of red and ballons in the lobby. I was quickly welcomed before I got my bags off the trunk and checked in in a flash. I expected fast service being in New York, but wow, the personal touch with a little welcome note from the hotel in my room, and the attentive and gracious staff, I trully enjoyed my short but sweet stay at the Mave. In town for business, this is a great location, and actually walked around and found I can be a tourist enjoying the scenerary, walked as far as my legs took me, and fond myself in Time Square. (20 blocks or so) This is a prime location but moreover, the hotel feel is chic, stylish, and vibrant. I stayed previously at another hotel and like most, dark furnishings and not much light in the room. but at the Mave, the hotel Shines!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but small”
Reviews.Author: Alice T
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful in helping us with everything from making dinner reservations to bringing ice up to our room. We had a King size room and it sounds like we had more space than most of the other reviews. We had a small desk with one chair and a WONDERFUL king size bed. The air conditioner was only a window unit and kept the room nice and cool. If you are looking for a room where you will only be sleeping and not spending a large amount of time I think this is an excellent deal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, simple, polite staff, noisy room...could be cheaper.”
Reviews.Author: AndyMaxx
Reviews.Content: We chose The MAve for our first 2 nights in NYC last weekend. We wanted to experience staying in 2 different areas, and spotted this hotel on Trip Advisor for our first. Was very new at the time, quite far down the ratings list...but only because it was recently added. Every hotel needs to start somewhere, so we decided to go for it. To start, the area is perfect. Very central. We prefer walking, so it is very well located to discover Midtown to Central Park. There is also a subway stop within 5 minutes, easy. Just round the corner from Madison Square Park (Shake Shack...a must, Flatiron Building, etc), down the road from Empire State, not too far from Union Square (great, student area...bars, restaurants). Now, the hotel... The staff upon arrival and throughout our stay...extremely helpful, courteous...tick all the boxes in so far as customer service goes. The room...we chose the Boulevard King, and found it to be very spacious and comfortable. BUT....and this is a massive problem....the noise. I am so happy that we were given ear plugs on our flight over to NYC because they really came in handy when we went to bed. Ear plugs + jet lag = pleasant combination when staying at The MAve. I had asked for high floor room because I had read some negative reviews about the noise...but we were put on the 6th, being assured that as our room was not actually on Madison Ave, the room would be quiet and peaceful. Everything you have read about noise so far is true....the 24/7 traffic carries, no matter which side of the hotel you stay on, and it is true indeed...the old style air conditioners fitted into the windows are flanked by flimsy plastic sheets...even with the windows closed, it sounds like they are wide open. I didn't complain about the noise - seriously, there is not a lot the staff can do. I am not a complainer, I am a put-up-with'er. And I did not have trouble sleeping...like I said, ear plugs and jet lag. We were all in all, comfortable, and we did have a generally pleasant, trouble free stay. A few closing comments: 1) The hotel has been open for most of the year now, so when will the 2nd elevator be sorted out? It wasn't such a big deal, only sometimes we had to wait for a more than a few minutes. 2) I would agree that this hotel is more of a trendy, up scale hostel, as there are zero facilities offered by the hotel direct (room service is catered for by restaurant up the road, and breakfast, although not experienced, also sounds like it is arranged externally, and according to other reviews...well...just go to a deli instead). Imagine a trendy New York apartment building, but instead of renting apartments, you are renting a room. That is kind of how it feels. 3) We did pay more for the Boulevard King...I don't like cramped rooms, and it turned out to be a nice size. But considering what's on offer in general, I do think they could slash the prices considerably. I dislike giving negative reviews - too often I read reviews from people who obviously just have anger problems or expect way too much. But I will be honest in what I write and overall, I think we could have done slightly better than The MAve for the price we paid. Such simple things like good noise insulation and at least a small, in house breakfast bar could make the world of difference.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale adult hostel, no working elevators or breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MaryCFP
Reviews.Content: Positives: friendly staff, free wifi, comfy bed & lots of pillows (very firm), H2O bathroom amenities, huge shower head, & near subway; Negatives: no working elevators and had to walk up seven flights of stairs with metal covering (VERY noisy), breakfast consisted of coffee at 8:30 am on Sunday, postage-size room (upgraded @ $20/night to queen, much better), all street noise penetrates wafer-thin accordian screen holding window heating/cooling system, area offers little of interest (well, there is the museum of sex.) If you try Hotwire and it comes up boutique hotel, this could be it. You will get hotwire room, as an earlier visitor noted. This hotel remains a work in progress. Needs more public space and a restaurant, and a public bathroom to use when your room is not ready. Staff can only do so much (and admitted 101% booked, so I guess it is popular.)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, new hotel that is still working out some minor kinks.”
Reviews.Author: Kat2006
Reviews.Content: The Mave is a lovely hotel in a great location right up from Madison Square Garden (the park, not the sports arena). The staff, from concierge to housekeeping, were among the friendliest and helpful I have ever come across. The rooms are very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel, as mentioned in other reviews, just opened in the summer and therefore some issues still need ironing out. Again as previously mentioned, there is a fair amount of noise that bleeds into the rooms through the window air conditioning/heater units however it didn't really bother us and we understand that they are working on fixing this. Our key cards had a tendency to deprogram and we found ourselves twice up on the seventh floor unable to unlock our door. The second time, there was a hotel employee on our floor who immediately let us into our room and ran downstairs to re-program our card for us. The fire alarms are a little too sensitive and went off twice when the steam from our shower escaped from the bathroom. Luckily the sprinkle didn't go off !! When I phoned the front desk to let them know, they were extremely apologetic and offered to send someone up right away. In my opinion, these are pretty minor issues and once they are addressed, The Mave will be top-notch. We look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: tracycul
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay and found almost everything to be excellent. The only problem is that the hotel is retrofitted and uses window unit heating and cooling. This lets in a good bit of noise. We talked with the front desk and they told me that they are ordering sound buffers to go around the unit. This should help alot. Otherwise the room is small but about average in NY. Certainly not the smallest I have stayed in. Don't stay in room alot in NYC. The staff is great. The location is good. The grab up breakfast is good. Just know there is nowhere to sit. The beds are nice and comfy. Hotel is clean, newly remodeled and good especially for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but be aware there are problems”
Reviews.Author: mikerush
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed one night this past weekend, October 3, 2009. Good rate through hotwire, $ 180+, plus taxes and agency fees. The hotel has just been renovated and is very nice. The staff is very friendly, the location is good and is near both east and westside subway stations. Breakfast is also very nice. The "Two Big Issues" that you need to be aware of. The rooms are very small. Our room did not have a chair, If you wanted to sit down you needed to sit on the bed. In order to get from one side of the room to the other, one person would need to move out of the way. In fairness to the hotel, our room appeared to be the smallest room on our floor, based on the door chart in our room. The heating and cooling system for the hotel is a unit similar to a traditional a/c window unit, with plastic on either side of the unit to cover the rest of the open window. This piece of plastic is 1/16 of an inch thick and is the only thing between you and the "City that never sleeps". No double glazed windows here, You will hear every sound that goes on outside. They may provide ear plugs, we did not ask. If you can get beyond the smallness and noise of the room, everything else is very nice and I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain too noisy”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoPair
Reviews.Content: The Mave has good and bad points. Unfortunately, the bad outweigh the good. First, the good: great location, friendly staff, very clean rooms, strong (and free) wifi signal. Now for the bad: noisy, noisy, noisy. We were on the second floor and the street noise bordered on the unbearable. We live in a city and are used to street noise, but this was over the top. There were times we thought people and cars were actually in our room. Ran the air conditioner constantly in a futile attempt to have the white noise block out the street noise, but even that didn't work. The noise really adversely impacted our stay -- but for that we could have overlooked the other problems. Which included the fact that the bathroom is so small they just have a half wall for a shower door. Which means the bathroom floor gets soaking wet every time someone takes a shower. I've experienced that in third world countries where the room costs $30 a night, but I do not expect that in Manhattan at the rates charged there. And, according to the in-room amenity description, extra towels costs extra -- we didn't try to order any so I can't say whether they would have actually charged us but, seriously, who charges extra for a towel when the room only has two towels to begin with? Finally, breakfast was not at all as advertised. The one morning we made it down in time for breakfast (at 8 am so not late), there was nothing left but some sort of rolls. Bottom line, we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Where did this little jewel come from?”
Reviews.Author: TravelsMuchGlobally
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed. There's no public space. There are red and white balloons where the restaurant should be. The rooms are typical NYC tiny. AND I LOVED THIS HOTEL. It's the people, people, people. Where did they find these sweet, professional, warm people? The leader of the front desk seems to be a brilliantly engaged woman named Annetta. She's a fire ball of warmth, professionalism and kindness. And her staff follows right behind. I'll give up not having a restaurant. I'll give up a lobby. I'll even give up a room with...well room. But I won't give up an empathetic staff. So that makes this my new favorite hotel in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: LizzyfromtheLou
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The MAve and had an experience second to none. The staff was amazing from the time we walked in until our final goodbye. The bed made in hard to leave the room, H20 products as well as the rain head showers are awesome, and the staff really sealed the deal. I felt like I had a personal assistant to the city, great recomendations in the area, and attention to deatail made my stay the best I have had in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: TandemWorld
Reviews.Content: Found a fantastic deal on this hotel and didn't quite know what to expect given that fantastic deals and NYC are a rare combination. We were very pleasantly surprised. Most noteworthy... THE STAFF - Every single person we came in contact with was very friendly and helpful. LOCATION - Perfectly situated in the middle of the city without being too close to Times Square. Easy access to the Theaters, Penn Station (take the train in from the airport!), and - most importantly - The Shake Shack! INCLUSIONS - Breakfast (small) and WiFi are included. Awesome! ROOMS - Although small (SMALL, small), they are well appointed, remarkably quiet and comfortable. AGE - They have done everything that they can given this is an update of an old building. Inconveniences (slow elevators, no restaurant, the smallest workout room on the planet) are minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, friendly”
Reviews.Author: McClainSeattle
Reviews.Content: Searching for a reasonably-priced hotel to stay in during the crush of Fashion Week, I found the highly-rated MAve on TripAdvisor. My colleagues and I spent 3 nights there earlier this week and found it to be worthy of the positive reviews. Yes the rooms are small, but they're very clean, the staff is super-helpful, and the hotel is conveniently located on Madison Avenue near Washington Square Park and the subway. It's a great value, and I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jsmcneel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from NYC for the first time. We took our 1 1/2 year old, and my wife and I. The Mave turned out to be great location for getting anywhere in midtown Manhattan. Madio (sp?), the door man and Aneta were the first two people that we met in NYC and they were good to us. They helped us navigate the city to all kinds of good places. The rooms were a little small, but from what we here, it is typical for the Manhattan. But, really, how much time do you spend in your room? The location was awesome. Within walking distance to Madison Park, Madison Square Garden, cheap shopping, Empire State Building and all kinds of other good things. I would stay in The MAve again.

Reviews.Title: “the website does not reflect this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: frantrav
Reviews.Content: Warning Warning...Great name Great Location..Then it all turns bad... This is not a boutique hotel .This Hotel is a budget tourist hotel. And they should be discounting the rates..
